job_description:
Junior Executive at Syngene

About Syngene

Syngene is a leading contract research organization (CRO) providing comprehensive drug discovery, development, and manufacturing services to the global pharmaceutical and biotechnology industries. Driven by a commitment to excellence, integrity, and professionalism, Syngene fosters a collaborative and innovative environment where scientific expertise meets operational excellence.

Job Summary

Syngene is seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Junior Executive to join our dynamic team. This role plays a crucial part in ensuring the smooth and efficient operation of our laboratory facilities, particularly during overnight and extended hours. The successful candidate will be responsible for overseeing chemical reactions, managing lab supplies, and maintaining a safe and organized work environment.

Responsibilities

  • Laboratory Operations:
    • Monitor and oversee overnight chemical reactions, ensuring proper execution and documentation.
    • Supervise hydrogenation lab activities beyond regular working hours, adhering to strict safety protocols.
    • Prepare and dispense inorganic chemicals required for laboratory operations, maintaining accurate inventory records.
    • Supply gases such as oxygen, argon, carbon dioxide, and ammonia to lab personnel as needed.
    • Safely neutralize toxic substances, following established procedures for waste disposal.
    • Transport materials used for quenching to designated stations, ensuring timely and safe handling.
  • Lab Maintenance:
    • Track and log cold room temperatures in the lab, maintaining optimal conditions for storage.
    • Monitor the refilling of fresh solvents, ensuring adequate supply for ongoing experiments.
    • Respond to emergencies arising from unforeseen lab incidents, implementing appropriate safety measures.
    • Power down lab equipment and instruments when not actively in use, conserving energy and preventing damage.
    • Prepare scrubber solutions on the terrace for use in column hoods, walk-in hoods, HTS labs, and ADC labs.

Requirements

  • Education: Bachelor's degree in Science (B.Sc) from a recognized university.
  • Experience: 0-3 years of relevant experience in a laboratory setting, preferably in a chemical research environment.
  • Skills:
    • Effective written and verbal communication abilities.
    • Proficiency in basic computer applications, including Excel and PowerPoint.
    • Practical knowledge in outbound/inbound logistics, SEZ and U.S.-related documentation, and a strong understanding of procurement and warehouse functions.
    • Ability to clearly understand departmental objectives and align personal work accordingly.
    • Demonstrated willingness to take responsibility and ownership of assigned tasks.

Syngene Core Values

All employees are expected to uphold the organization's core values:

  • Excellence: Striving for the highest quality in all aspects of work.
  • Integrity: Adhering to ethical principles and maintaining transparency in all actions.
  • Professionalism: Demonstrating respect, accountability, and a commitment to continuous improvement.
key_responsibility:
Junior Executive - Key Responsibilities at Syngene

This role focuses on supporting laboratory operations, ensuring safety, and maintaining a well-organized and efficient work environment.

Laboratory Operations Support

  • Chemical Handling and Management:

    • Supply gases like oxygen, argon, carbon dioxide, and ammonia to lab personnel as needed, adhering to safety guidelines.
    • Safely neutralize toxic substances using appropriate procedures and personal protective equipment.
    • Track and log cold room temperatures, maintaining optimal conditions for stored materials.

  • Overnight and After-Hours Support:

Equipment and Facility Maintenance

  • Equipment Management:

  • Facility Maintenance:
    • Transport materials used for quenching to designated stations, ensuring proper disposal and safety.
    • Prepare scrubber solutions on the terrace for use in various lab areas (column hoods, walk-in hoods, HTS labs, and ADC labs), maintaining air quality and safety.

Syngene Core Values

The Junior Executive is expected to embody Syngene's core values of Excellence, Integrity, and Professionalism in all aspects of their work. This includes:

  • Excellence: Consistently striving for high-quality work, accuracy, and efficiency in all tasks.
  • Integrity: Maintaining honesty, transparency, and ethical conduct in all interactions and decisions.
  • Professionalism: Demonstrating respect, responsibility, and a commitment to continuous learning and improvement.

qualification:
Avasoft QA and Business Analyst: Qualifications & Requirements

This role requires a blend of technical expertise and analytical skills to ensure software quality and align product development with business needs.

I. Essential Technical Skills

  • Software Testing Methodologies: A strong understanding of various testing methodologies (e.g., black box, white box, regression, integration) is crucial. This ensures the candidate can design and execute comprehensive test plans to identify and resolve software defects. Proficiency in both manual and automated testing is highly desirable.
  • Defect Tracking and Management: Experience with defect tracking tools (e.g., Jira, Bugzilla) is essential for logging, prioritizing, and managing software defects throughout the development lifecycle. This ensures efficient communication and collaboration between development and QA teams.
  • SQL Querying: Basic to intermediate SQL skills are necessary for querying databases, verifying data integrity, and understanding data relationships within the software system. This allows the analyst to validate data accuracy and identify potential issues.

II. Business Analysis Skills

  • Requirements Elicitation and Documentation: The ability to effectively gather, analyze, and document business requirements is paramount. This involves conducting stakeholder interviews, workshops, and analyzing existing documentation to understand user needs and translate them into clear, concise specifications.
  • Process Analysis and Improvement: Experience in analyzing existing business processes and identifying areas for improvement is valuable. This involves mapping out workflows, identifying bottlenecks, and proposing solutions to streamline operations and enhance efficiency.
  • Communication and Collaboration: Excellent communication and interpersonal skills are essential for collaborating with developers, stakeholders, and other team members. This includes clearly articulating requirements, providing constructive feedback, and facilitating effective communication throughout the project lifecycle.

III. Additional Qualifications

  • Experience with Agile methodologies: Familiarity with Agile principles and practices (e.g., Scrum, Kanban) is beneficial for working in a fast-paced, iterative development environment.
  • Knowledge of relevant industry standards: Understanding of industry-specific quality standards and best practices (e.g., ISO 9001) is a plus.

These qualifications ensure the candidate possesses the necessary skills and knowledge to effectively contribute to Avasoft's software development process, ensuring high-quality products that meet business objectives.
job_description:
QA and Business Analyst at Avasoft

About Avasoft

[Insert a brief and engaging description of Avasoft, highlighting its mission, values, and industry.]

Job Summary

Avasoft is seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented QA and Business Analyst to join our growing team. This role requires a strong understanding of both business analysis principles and quality assurance methodologies. The ideal candidate will possess excellent communication and analytical skills, with a passion for ensuring the delivery of high-quality software solutions.

Key Responsibilities

  • Business Analysis:
    • Collaborate with stakeholders across various departments to gather and analyze business requirements.
    • Elicit, document, and prioritize user stories, functional specifications, and other requirement documentation using industry-standard tools and techniques.
    • Participate in meetings and workshops to clarify business objectives, identify potential risks, and ensure alignment with project goals.
  • Quality Assurance:
    • Develop and execute comprehensive test cases covering functional, non-functional, and regression aspects of software applications.
    • Conduct both manual and automated testing, utilizing Selenium (Java or Python) to streamline test execution and improve efficiency.
    • Write and validate SQL queries to verify data integrity and functionality within databases.
    • Log and track defects, providing detailed descriptions and steps to reproduce issues.
    • Assist business users during User Acceptance Testing (UAT), providing guidance and support to ensure successful sign-off.

Essential Skills and Qualifications

  • Proven experience in both Business Analysis and Quality Assurance roles.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a meticulous attention to detail.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to effectively convey technical information to both technical and non-technical audiences.
  • Proficiency in documenting requirements, test scenarios, and test outcomes using clear and concise language.
  • Hands-on experience with automation testing tools, specifically Selenium (Java or Python).
  • Basic understanding of SQL for writing and validating simple queries.
  • Familiarity with Agile development methodologies and software development lifecycle (SDLC) principles.
key_responsibility:
Key Responsibilities for QA and Business Analyst at Avasoft

Business Analysis:

  • Requirement Gathering and Analysis:

    • Actively participate in meetings with stakeholders (developers, product managers, clients) to understand their needs and translate them into clear, concise business requirements.
    • Conduct workshops and interviews to elicit detailed information about desired functionalities, workflows, and user stories.
    • Analyze existing systems and processes to identify areas for improvement and potential risks.
    • Expected Outcome: Comprehensive documentation of business requirements, including user stories, functional specifications, and use cases, ensuring all stakeholders have a shared understanding.

  • Documentation and Communication:

    • Draft and maintain detailed documentation of business requirements, including user stories, functional specifications, and process flows.
    • Clearly articulate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders and vice versa.
    • Prepare presentations and reports to communicate findings and recommendations to relevant teams.
    • Expected Outcome: Accurate and accessible documentation that serves as a single source of truth for project stakeholders, facilitating effective communication and collaboration.

Quality Assurance:

  • Test Case Development and Execution:

    • Design and develop comprehensive test cases based on documented business requirements and user stories.
    • Define test scenarios covering various functionalities, user flows, and edge cases.
    • Execute both manual and automated tests to verify the functionality, usability, and performance of the software.
    • Expected Outcome: Thoroughly tested software that meets predefined quality standards and addresses potential defects before release.

  • Defect Tracking and Reporting:

    • Log and track defects discovered during testing using a bug tracking system.
    • Provide detailed descriptions of defects, including steps to reproduce, expected behavior, and actual results.
    • Collaborate with developers to resolve identified defects and ensure timely fixes.
    • Expected Outcome: Efficient defect management process that leads to the delivery of high-quality software.

  • Automation Testing:

    • Utilize automation testing tools like Selenium (Java or Python) to automate repetitive test cases.
    • Develop and maintain automated test scripts to improve testing efficiency and coverage.
    • Expected Outcome: Reduced manual testing effort, increased test coverage, and faster feedback loops.

Collaboration and Support:

  • Stakeholder Collaboration:

    • Work closely with developers, product managers, and clients to ensure alignment on requirements, testing strategies, and project timelines.
    • Provide clear and concise communication regarding testing progress, identified defects, and potential risks.
    • Expected Outcome: Strong collaboration and communication within the development team, leading to a successful project outcome.

  • User Acceptance Testing (UAT) Support:

    • Assist business users during UAT by providing guidance on testing procedures and addressing any questions or concerns.
    • Gather feedback from users and document any issues or discrepancies.
    • Expected Outcome: Successful completion of UAT, ensuring the software meets user expectations and business requirements.

  • Communication Skills: Effective written and verbal communication skills are necessary for collaborating with internal teams, external stakeholders, and regulatory bodies. Interns should be able to clearly articulate compliance concerns, explain complex concepts, and present recommendations in a concise and persuasive manner.
  • Attention to Detail: Payments compliance requires meticulous attention to detail. Interns must be able to identify discrepancies, review documentation carefully, and ensure adherence to strict regulatory guidelines.

Experience:

  • Internship or Relevant Experience (Preferred): Prior experience in a compliance-related role, such as an internship at a financial institution or regulatory body, is highly beneficial. This experience provides practical exposure to compliance processes and challenges.

Note: This is a general guideline, and specific requirements may vary depending on the team and project.
job_description:
Intern, Payments Compliance

Company: PhonePe

Position: Industrial Trainee – Payments Compliance

Internship Duration: 12 months

About PhonePe:

PhonePe is a leading digital payments platform in India, empowering millions of users to transact seamlessly. Committed to innovation and customer satisfaction, PhonePe strives to create a secure and inclusive financial ecosystem.

Job Description:

This internship offers a unique opportunity to gain hands-on experience in the dynamic world of payments compliance within a rapidly growing FinTech company. The intern will work closely with the compliance team, supporting various regulatory initiatives and contributing to the overall compliance framework.

Roles and Responsibilities:

  • Regulatory Monitoring: Track and analyze updates in Indian payment regulations, including circulars and guidelines issued by the Reserve Bank of India (RBI), National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI), and other relevant authorities.
  • Compliance Support: Assist internal teams by addressing their queries related to compliance and regulatory obligations, ensuring adherence to applicable laws and guidelines.
  • Stakeholder Communication: Provide timely updates to all stakeholders regarding the progress of ongoing regulatory initiatives, fostering transparency and collaboration.
  • Documentation and Archiving: Collect and archive supporting documents from various stakeholders as proof of regulatory implementation for audit purposes, maintaining a comprehensive and organized record.
  • Compliance Certifications: Contribute to preparing and issuing compliance certifications for periodic regulatory implementations in collaboration with key stakeholders, demonstrating PhonePe's commitment to regulatory compliance.
  • Policy Updates: Aid in updating internal compliance policies and frameworks to reflect the latest regulatory changes, ensuring alignment with evolving industry standards.
  • Regulatory Reviews: Provide support during regulatory reviews or inspections, assisting in ensuring timely resolution of findings with relevant teams.
  • Audit Support: Coordinate with internal departments to communicate audit requirements and clarify any related findings, facilitating a smooth audit process.
  • Research and Analysis: Conduct focused research on compliance topics relevant to the payments industry, such as Know Your Customer (KYC)/Anti-Money Laundering (AML), data localization, and transaction surveillance, staying abreast of emerging trends and best practices.

Candidate Requirements:

  • Academic Background: Educational background in audit, compliance, or finance, preferably with industry certifications or a university degree.
  • Regulatory Knowledge: Foundational knowledge or a genuine interest in India’s financial and regulatory environment, particularly in payments (e.g., RBI, NPCI, PMLA).
  • Analytical Skills: Strong attention to detail, especially when reviewing product-specific regulations and control frameworks.
  • Communication Skills: Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to engage effectively with senior stakeholders and global teams.
  • Technical Proficiency: Proficient in English, both written and verbal, with strong report-writing skills requiring minimal supervision. Familiarity with Microsoft Office applications (Excel, Word, PowerPoint).

What You’ll Gain:

  • Practical Experience: Deep exposure to payment compliance practices in India, gaining practical experience in regulatory reporting and monitoring.
  • Mentorship: Mentorship from seasoned professionals in compliance, benefiting from their expertise and guidance.
  • Industry Insights: Insight into the dynamic and rapidly evolving FinTech landscape in India, understanding the challenges and opportunities within the sector.
  • Career Development: An opportunity to play a key role in upholding regulatory standards at a growing organization, contributing to PhonePe's success while developing valuable skills for a future career in compliance.
key_responsibility:
Key Responsibilities: Intern, Payments Compliance (PhonePe)

This role focuses on supporting PhonePe's compliance team in ensuring adherence to Indian payment regulations.

Regulatory Monitoring and Analysis:

  • Track Regulatory Updates: Continuously monitor and analyze updates to Indian payment regulations, including circulars and guidelines issued by the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) and other relevant authorities. This involves staying abreast of changes in KYC/AML, data localization, transaction surveillance, and other pertinent regulations.
  • Analyze Regulatory Impact: Evaluate the impact of new or amended regulations on PhonePe's operations and products. This includes identifying potential compliance gaps and recommending solutions to mitigate risks.

Internal Compliance Support:

  • Address Compliance Queries: Provide timely and accurate responses to internal teams' queries regarding compliance requirements and regulatory obligations. This may involve explaining specific regulations, interpreting guidelines, or providing guidance on implementing compliance measures.
  • Communicate Regulatory Updates: Disseminate timely updates to all relevant stakeholders regarding the progress of ongoing regulatory initiatives, new regulations, and changes in compliance requirements.

Documentation and Reporting:

  • Collect and Archive Documents: Gather and archive supporting documents from various stakeholders to demonstrate compliance with regulatory requirements. This documentation will be used for internal audits and external regulatory inspections.
  • Prepare Compliance Certifications: Assist in preparing and issuing compliance certifications for periodic regulatory implementations. This involves collaborating with key stakeholders to gather necessary information and ensure accurate reporting.
  • Update Compliance Policies: Contribute to updating internal compliance policies and frameworks to reflect the latest regulatory changes. This ensures that PhonePe's policies remain aligned with current regulations and best practices.

Audit Support:

  • Coordinate Audit Activities: Coordinate with internal departments to communicate audit requirements and clarify any related findings. This involves scheduling audits, providing necessary documentation, and facilitating communication between auditors and relevant teams.
  • Document Audit Responses: Assist management in documenting audit responses, implementing corrective actions as recommended, and ensuring closure of non-IT related audit points. This ensures that PhonePe addresses audit findings promptly and effectively.

Research and Analysis:

  • Conduct Compliance Research: Conduct focused research on compliance topics relevant to the payments industry, such as KYC/AML, data localization, and transaction surveillance. This research will inform PhonePe's compliance strategy and help identify emerging risks.

This comprehensive list of responsibilities provides a clear understanding of the intern's role in supporting PhonePe's compliance efforts.

About PhonePe

PhonePe is India's leading digital payments platform, empowering millions of users to transact seamlessly and securely. As a subsidiary of Walmart, PhonePe leverages its parent company's global expertise and resources to drive innovation and financial inclusion across the country.

Mission: PhonePe's mission is to democratize access to financial services and simplify everyday transactions for everyone. They strive to build a trusted and reliable platform that fosters financial literacy and empowers individuals to manage their finances effectively.

Culture: PhonePe fosters a dynamic and collaborative work environment that values innovation, customer focus, and integrity. The company encourages its employees to think creatively, take ownership, and contribute to its mission of building a financially inclusive India.

Market Position: PhonePe holds a dominant market share in the Indian digital payments space, with a vast network of merchants and users across the country. Their comprehensive suite of services, including UPI payments, bill payments, recharges, and investments, caters to a wide range of customer needs.

Growth Trajectory: PhonePe is experiencing rapid growth, driven by increasing smartphone penetration, digital literacy, and the government's push towards a cashless economy. The company continues to invest in technology, expand its product offerings, and build strategic partnerships to solidify its position as the leading digital payments platform in India.
selection_process:

This multi-stage process aims to identify candidates with a strong understanding of Indian payment regulations, analytical skills, and a passion for compliance.

1. Application Screening (1 week)

  • Who's involved: HR team and hiring manager.
  • Duration: 1 week.

2. Online Assessment (2 days)

  • What happens: Candidates complete an online assessment testing their knowledge of Indian financial regulations, analytical skills, and attention to detail.
  • Who's involved: HR team and potentially an external assessment provider.
  • Duration: 2 days.
  • Evaluation criteria: Accuracy, speed, and comprehension of regulatory concepts, problem-solving abilities, and attention to detail.
  • Candidate expectations: Prepare for a timed assessment covering regulatory knowledge and analytical skills.

3. Video Interview (1 week)

  • What happens: Shortlisted candidates participate in a video interview with an HR representative and/or a member of the compliance team.
  • Who's involved: HR representative and/or compliance team member.
  • Duration: 1 week (scheduling flexibility).
  • Evaluation criteria: Communication skills, enthusiasm, understanding of the role, and cultural fit.
  • Candidate expectations: Prepare for behavioral questions and demonstrate strong communication skills.

4. Technical Interview (1 week)

  • What happens: Candidates selected from the video interview stage participate in a technical interview with a senior compliance professional.

5. Final Decision (1 week)

qualification:
Junior Developer (Fresher) Qualifications & Requirements at Numentica

This section outlines the typical qualifications and requirements for a Junior Developer (Fresher) position at Numentica.

Education:

  • Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field: A strong foundation in computer science principles is essential for understanding programming concepts, algorithms, and data structures. This degree provides the theoretical knowledge necessary to build and maintain software applications.

Technical Skills:

  • Proficiency in at least one programming language (e.g., Python, Java, JavaScript): Junior Developers need to be able to write clean, efficient, and well-documented code. Proficiency in a popular programming language is crucial for developing and implementing software solutions.
  • Basic understanding of data structures and algorithms: Knowledge of data structures like arrays, lists, and trees, and algorithms like sorting and searching, is fundamental for designing efficient and scalable software.
  • Familiarity with version control systems (e.g., Git): Version control is essential for collaborative development, tracking changes, and managing code history.

Soft Skills:

  • Strong problem-solving and analytical skills: Junior Developers often encounter bugs and challenges while coding. The ability to analyze problems, identify root causes, and develop solutions is crucial.
  • Excellent communication and teamwork skills: Software development is a collaborative process. Junior Developers need to effectively communicate with team members, understand requirements, and contribute to project discussions.
  • Eagerness to learn and adapt: The tech industry is constantly evolving. A willingness to learn new technologies, programming languages, and development methodologies is essential for long-term success.

These qualifications provide a strong foundation for a Junior Developer to contribute to Numentica's projects and grow within the company.
job_description:
Junior Developer (Fresher) at Numentica

About Numentica

[Insert a brief and engaging description of Numentica, highlighting its mission, values, and industry position. Mention its size, culture, and any relevant achievements.]

Job Summary

Numentica is seeking a motivated and detail-oriented Junior Developer to join our growing team. This role is ideal for recent graduates with a passion for software development and a strong foundation in testing methodologies. The successful candidate will collaborate closely with developers, business analysts, and project managers to ensure the delivery of high-quality software solutions.

Responsibilities

  • Collaborate and Understand: Work closely with cross-functional teams to comprehend project objectives, align them with industry standards, and ensure they align with the product's core features.
  • Execute and Document Testing: Execute automated test scripts, meticulously document results, and log any defects with comprehensive diagnostics to facilitate effective troubleshooting.
  • Design and Maintain Test Scenarios: Design, maintain, and run automated test scenarios, contributing to the development and refinement of comprehensive test suites.
  • Write and Refine Test Code: Write, evaluate, and refine unit tests and other related test code, particularly in Python, ensuring code quality and maintainability.
  • Manage Test Environments: Set up and manage test environments and automation frameworks, ensuring a stable and reliable testing infrastructure.
  • Communicate Test Outcomes: Effectively communicate test outcomes to developers, providing clear explanations and supporting them in understanding quality benchmarks and release criteria.
  • Contribute to Test Planning: Participate in release planning sessions, providing accurate time and effort estimates for testing activities.
  • Maintain Quality Standards: Demonstrate a strong commitment to maintaining high standards of product quality throughout the development lifecycle.

Qualifications & Experience

  • Education: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.
  • Experience: 0-2 years of professional experience in software testing or related fields.
  • Technical Skills:
    • Solid understanding of automated testing principles and methodologies.
    • Proven experience testing web applications, including both frontend and backend components.
    • Proficiency in Python or Java for test automation.
    • Experience with API testing (RESTful and SOAP).
    • Familiarity with XML, databases, and SQL queries.
    • Hands-on experience with test automation frameworks like Selenium (Python or JavaScript).
    • Comfortable working with version control platforms like GitLab or Bitbucket.
    • Experience using defect tracking tools like JIRA.
  • Soft Skills:
    • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, particularly in technical environments.
    • Ability to work effectively in agile, collaborative teams.
    • Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.
    • Self-motivated, detail-oriented, and committed to quality.

Additional Requirements

  • Excellent written and spoken English communication skills are essential.

Benefits

Numentica offers a comprehensive benefits package designed to support the well-being and professional growth of its employees. This includes:

  • Flexible Work Arrangements: Opportunities for hybrid/remote work to promote work-life balance.
  • Generous Paid Time Off: Flexible paid time off policies to encourage rest and rejuvenation.
  • Mentorship and Development: Structured mentorship programs and career growth opportunities to foster professional development.
  • Health and Wellness: Competitive health insurance packages, parental leave, and other wellness initiatives.
  • Community Engagement: Opportunities to participate in volunteer initiatives and philanthropic efforts.
  • Employee Recognition: Peer-nominated reward programs to celebrate achievements and contributions.
key_responsibility:
Key Responsibilities of a Junior Developer (Fresher) at Numentica

This section outlines the core duties and responsibilities expected of a Junior Developer at Numentica.

Software Testing & Quality Assurance:

  • Test Execution & Documentation:
    • Execute automated test scripts developed for various software components.
    • Meticulously document test results, including pass/fail status, observed behavior, and any deviations from expected outcomes.
    • Log defects encountered during testing, providing detailed diagnostics and steps to reproduce the issue for effective troubleshooting by developers.
  • Test Automation:
    • Design, develop, and maintain automated test scenarios using Python and relevant frameworks like Selenium.
    • Write, evaluate, and refine unit tests to ensure the functionality and integrity of individual code modules.
    • Set up and manage test environments, including configuring necessary software, databases, and dependencies.
  • Collaboration & Communication:
    • Actively participate in discussions with developers, business analysts, and project managers to understand project requirements and ensure alignment with quality standards.
    • Clearly communicate test outcomes to developers, highlighting areas of concern and providing insights into quality benchmarks and release criteria.
    • Contribute to test planning by providing accurate time and effort estimates during release planning sessions.

Technical Proficiency & Development:

  • Programming Skills:
    • Demonstrate proficiency in Python for test automation and scripting.
    • Possess a foundational understanding of other relevant programming languages like Java.
  • API Testing:
    • Conduct thorough testing of RESTful and SOAP-based APIs, validating data exchange and functionality.
  • Database Interaction:
    • Work with databases, executing SQL queries to verify data integrity and test application interactions with data stores.
  • Version Control & Collaboration Tools:
    • Utilize version control platforms like GitLab or Bitbucket to manage code changes and collaborate effectively with team members.
    • Familiarize oneself with defect tracking tools like JIRA to log and track issues throughout the development lifecycle.

General Responsibilities:

  • Time Management & Prioritization:
    • Effectively manage time and prioritize tasks to meet project deadlines while maintaining a high level of quality.
  • Continuous Learning:
    • Demonstrate a strong commitment to continuous learning and improvement, staying abreast of industry best practices and emerging technologies in software testing.
  • Teamwork & Communication:
    • Collaborate effectively with team members, fostering a positive and productive work environment.
    • Communicate clearly and concisely, both verbally and in writing, to convey technical information to both technical and non-technical audiences.

selection_process:
Numentica Junior Developer (Fresher) Hiring Workflow

This multi-stage process aims to identify candidates with the technical skills, problem-solving abilities, and collaborative spirit essential for success as a Junior Developer at Numentica.

1. Application Screening (Duration: 1 week)

  • What happens: Candidates submit their resumes and cover letters through the job portal. The Numentica team reviews applications, focusing on relevant education, experience, and technical skills outlined in the job description.
  • Who's involved: HR team, Hiring Manager
  • Evaluation criteria: Alignment with minimum qualifications, relevant experience, strong communication in resume and cover letter.
  • Candidate expectations: Submit a well-structured resume highlighting relevant skills and experience, and a compelling cover letter demonstrating interest in the role and Numentica.

2. Technical Assessment (Duration: 2 weeks)

  • What happens: Shortlisted candidates complete an online technical assessment platform. This may include coding challenges, multiple-choice questions on testing methodologies, and scenario-based problem-solving tasks.
  • Who's involved: Hiring Manager, Technical Lead
  • Evaluation criteria: Problem-solving skills, understanding of testing principles, proficiency in Python, and ability to apply technical knowledge to practical scenarios.
  • Candidate expectations: Prepare for coding challenges and technical questions related to software testing and Python programming.

3. Video Interview (Duration: 1 week)

  • What happens: Candidates selected from the technical assessment participate in a video interview with the Hiring Manager and potentially a team member. This allows for a deeper understanding of their communication skills, personality fit, and motivation for the role.
  • Who's involved: Hiring Manager, Team Member (optional)
  • Evaluation criteria: Communication skills, technical knowledge, problem-solving approach, cultural fit, and enthusiasm for the role.
  • Candidate expectations: Prepare for behavioral questions, technical discussions, and questions about their experience and career goals.

4. Final Interview (Duration: 1 week)

  • What happens: Top candidates are invited for a final interview with senior leadership. This stage focuses on assessing their potential for growth within Numentica, their understanding of the company's values, and their long-term career aspirations.
  • Who's involved: Hiring Manager, Senior Leadership
  • Evaluation criteria: Leadership potential, strategic thinking, cultural alignment, and long-term career goals.
  • Candidate expectations: Demonstrate a strong understanding of Numentica's mission and values, articulate their career goals, and showcase their ability to contribute to the company's success.

5. Offer and Onboarding (Duration: 2 weeks)

  • What happens: The selected candidate receives a formal job offer outlining compensation, benefits, and start date. Successful candidates undergo a comprehensive onboarding process to integrate into the team and company culture.
  • Who's involved: HR team, Hiring Manager, Onboarding team
  • Evaluation criteria: Candidate acceptance of the offer and successful completion of the onboarding program.
  • Candidate expectations: Review the offer carefully, negotiate terms if necessary, and actively participate in the onboarding process.

job_description:
Graduate Engineer Trainee at Johnson Controls

About Johnson Controls

Johnson Controls is a global leader in building technologies and solutions, committed to creating a sustainable and comfortable future for all. With a rich history of innovation and a diverse portfolio of products and services, Johnson Controls empowers customers to optimize energy efficiency, enhance security, and improve the overall occupant experience.

Job Summary

Johnson Controls is seeking highly motivated and talented individuals to join our Graduate Engineer Trainee program. As a Graduate Engineer Trainee, you will play a vital role in supporting global Building Automation System (BAS) projects. This program provides a comprehensive learning experience, equipping you with the skills and knowledge necessary to excel in a dynamic and challenging engineering environment.

Key Responsibilities

  • Execute design and application engineering tasks related to Building Management Systems (HVAC), including system configuration, control logic development, and troubleshooting.
  • Assist senior engineers in developing project execution plans, ensuring adherence to project timelines and budget constraints.
  • Participate in project meetings, providing technical input and collaborating effectively with cross-functional teams.
  • Conduct thorough testing and quality assurance procedures to ensure the delivery of defect-free hardware and software solutions.
  • Adhere to established company processes and safety protocols, contributing to a safe and efficient work environment.
  • Actively participate in training programs and workshops, expanding your technical expertise and industry knowledge.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor of Engineering (B.E.) or Bachelor of Technology (B.Tech) in Instrumentation, Instrumentation & Control, Electronics & Instrumentation, or Electrical Engineering.
  • Graduation year: 2025.
  • Minimum 55% aggregate marks in SSC, HSC, and graduation.

Desired Skills

  • Strong observational abilities and a genuine desire to learn.
  • Excellent team collaboration and communication skills.
  • Analytical and critical thinking capabilities.
  • Proficiency in relevant engineering software tools.

Benefits

Johnson Controls offers a comprehensive benefits package designed to support the well-being and professional growth of our employees. This includes:

  • Competitive compensation commensurate with experience and qualifications.
  • Paid time off, including holidays, vacation, and sick leave.
  • Opportunities for on-the-job and cross-functional training.
  • A supportive and team-oriented work culture.
  • A strong commitment to safety through our Zero Harm initiative.

Probation Period

The probation period for this position is 12 months.
key_responsibility:

Project Support & Execution:

    • Analyzing building requirements and developing HVAC system designs.
    • Selecting appropriate equipment and components based on project specifications.
    • Creating technical documentation and drawings for HVAC systems.
  • Project Planning: Assist senior engineers in developing project execution plans. This involves:
    • Defining project scope, timelines, and resource allocation.
    • Identifying potential risks and developing mitigation strategies.

Quality Assurance & Delivery:

    • Documenting testing procedures and results.
  • Process Adherence: Adhere to established processes and timelines to ensure project success. This includes:

Professional Development:

  • Continuous Learning: Demonstrate a strong desire to learn and grow within the company. This involves:

    • Actively participating in team discussions and knowledge sharing.
    • Staying updated on industry trends and advancements.

job_description:
Junior Engineer – QA Intern at Cornerstone

About Cornerstone

Cornerstone OnDemand is a global leader in cloud-based learning and talent management solutions. We empower organizations to build a thriving workforce by providing innovative software that helps them recruit, develop, engage, and retain top talent.

Job Overview

Cornerstone is seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Junior Engineer – QA Intern to join our Global Customer Support Team in Pune, Maharashtra. This internship provides a valuable opportunity to gain hands-on experience in quality assurance within a dynamic and fast-paced environment. The intern will work closely with senior engineers and QA specialists to ensure the delivery of high-quality software solutions.

Key Responsibilities

  • Assist in the development and execution of test cases for new features and bug fixes.
  • Identify, document, and track software defects using bug tracking tools.
  • Perform functional, regression, and usability testing to ensure software quality.
  • Collaborate with developers to understand requirements and identify potential testing scenarios.
  • Analyze test results and provide detailed reports to the QA team and developers.
  • Contribute to the improvement of testing processes and documentation.
  • Stay up-to-date with industry best practices in software testing.

Qualifications & Skills

  • Pursuing a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
  • Strong understanding of software development life cycle (SDLC) methodologies.
  • Familiarity with various testing types (functional, regression, usability, etc.).
  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
  • (Preferred) Experience with testing tools and frameworks.
  • (Preferred) Knowledge of SQL and scripting languages.

Location: On-site in Pune, Maharashtra.
key_responsibility:
Junior Engineer – QA Intern at Cornerstone: Key Responsibilities

This section outlines the core duties and responsibilities expected of a Junior Engineer – QA Intern at Cornerstone.

Customer Support & Issue Resolution:

  • Provide Level 1 Technical Support: Assist Cornerstone OnDemand clients via phone, email, and Salesforce CRM, addressing inquiries about product functionality, troubleshooting software issues, and guiding users through product features.
  • Ensure Positive Customer Experience: Strive to deliver exceptional customer service, aiming for high Customer Satisfaction (CSAT) scores by resolving issues promptly, communicating clearly, and demonstrating empathy.
  • Adhere to Service Level Agreements (SLAs): Follow established support protocols and procedures to ensure timely issue resolution and meet predefined service level agreements.
  • Case Management & Prioritization: Effectively manage customer cases within Salesforce, providing regular updates, prioritizing issues based on client impact, and aiming for timely resolutions that align with customer expectations.

Troubleshooting & Escalation:

  • Utilize Support Resources: Leverage internal knowledge bases, documentation, and support tools to diagnose and resolve technical issues independently.
  • Escalate Complex Cases: When unable to resolve issues independently, efficiently escalate complex cases to senior engineers, providing thorough documentation and context to ensure smooth handover.
  • Collaborate with Team Members: Work collaboratively with other support engineers, sharing knowledge, best practices, and insights to improve team performance and customer support effectiveness.

Continuous Learning & Development:

  • Product Knowledge Expansion: Actively engage in continuous learning to deepen understanding of the Cornerstone OnDemand product suite, its functionalities, and underlying technologies.
  • Stay Updated on Industry Trends: Keep abreast of industry best practices, emerging technologies, and evolving customer support trends to enhance skills and contribute to the team's knowledge base.

selection_process:
Cornerstone - Junior Engineer – QA Intern Hiring Workflow

This multi-stage process aims to identify candidates with the technical aptitude, communication skills, and customer-centric attitude essential for success as a Junior Engineer – QA Intern at Cornerstone.

1. Application Screening (Duration: 1 week)

  • What happens: Resumes and cover letters are reviewed against pre-defined criteria focusing on education, relevant experience, and skills mentioned in the job description.
  • Who's involved: HR team and hiring manager.
  • Evaluation criteria: Alignment with minimum qualifications, relevant experience, communication skills demonstrated in the application materials.
  • Candidate expectations: Submit a complete and well-structured application highlighting relevant skills and experiences.

2. Online Assessment (Duration: 2 days)

  • What happens: Shortlisted candidates complete an online assessment covering technical aptitude (e.g., coding, troubleshooting) and soft skills (e.g., communication, problem-solving).
  • Who's involved: Candidates and Cornerstone's assessment platform.
  • Evaluation criteria: Performance on technical and soft skills assessments, demonstrating understanding of fundamental concepts and problem-solving abilities.
  • Candidate expectations: Allocate sufficient time to complete the assessment thoroughly and accurately.

3. Phone Interview (Duration: 30 minutes)

  • What happens: A brief phone interview with an HR representative to assess communication skills, personality fit, and basic understanding of the role.
  • Who's involved: Candidate and HR representative.
  • Evaluation criteria: Clarity of communication, enthusiasm for the role, alignment with company culture.
  • Candidate expectations: Prepare concise answers to common interview questions and demonstrate genuine interest in the opportunity.

4. Technical Interview (Duration: 60 minutes)

  • What happens: A technical interview with a member of the engineering team to evaluate coding skills, problem-solving abilities, and understanding of QA principles.
  • Who's involved: Candidate and a Cornerstone engineer.
  • Evaluation criteria: Technical proficiency, ability to articulate solutions, understanding of QA methodologies.
  • Candidate expectations: Be prepared to discuss technical concepts, solve coding challenges, and demonstrate a passion for quality assurance.

5. Final Interview (Duration: 90 minutes)

  • What happens: A final interview with the hiring manager and potentially other team members to assess cultural fit, leadership potential, and overall suitability for the role.
  • Who's involved: Candidate, hiring manager, and potentially other team members.
  • Evaluation criteria: Alignment with company values, communication style, teamwork skills, long-term career goals.
  • Candidate expectations: Showcase enthusiasm, articulate career aspirations, and demonstrate a strong understanding of Cornerstone's mission and values.

6. Offer and Onboarding (Duration: 2 weeks)

  • What happens: Selected candidates receive a formal job offer outlining compensation, benefits, and start date. Successful candidates undergo onboarding procedures, including paperwork, training, and introductions to the team.
  • Who's involved: HR team, hiring manager, and new employee.

This comprehensive selection process ensures Cornerstone hires qualified and enthusiastic individuals who will thrive in their QA Intern role and contribute to the company's success.

qualification:
Vestas Trainee Engineer: Typical Qualifications & Requirements

This section outlines the typical qualifications and requirements for a Trainee Engineer position at Vestas, a global leader in wind energy solutions.

Education:

  • Bachelor's Degree in Engineering: A strong foundation in engineering principles is essential. Vestas seeks candidates with degrees in disciplines such as Mechanical, Electrical, Civil, or Industrial Engineering. This academic background provides the theoretical knowledge and problem-solving skills necessary to understand complex wind turbine systems.
  • Relevant Coursework: Specific coursework in areas like mechanics, thermodynamics, materials science, control systems, or electrical power systems is highly desirable. These courses directly relate to the design, operation, and maintenance of wind turbines.

Skills:

  • Technical Proficiency: Trainee Engineers should possess a solid understanding of engineering concepts and be comfortable working with technical drawings, schematics, and software tools. Familiarity with CAD software, simulation tools, and data analysis programs is beneficial.
  • Problem-Solving & Analytical Skills: Wind turbine technology presents unique challenges. Trainee Engineers must be able to analyze problems, identify root causes, and develop effective solutions.
  • Communication & Teamwork: Vestas operates in a collaborative environment. Strong communication skills, both written and verbal, are crucial for interacting with colleagues, supervisors, and clients. Teamwork is essential for successful project execution.

Other Requirements:

  • Strong Work Ethic: Trainee Engineers are expected to be dedicated, reliable, and eager to learn.
  • Adaptability & Flexibility: The wind energy industry is constantly evolving. Trainee Engineers should be adaptable to new technologies and willing to take on diverse tasks.

These qualifications provide a framework for aspiring engineers seeking to join Vestas and contribute to the advancement of wind energy.
job_description:
Trainee Engineer

Company: Vestas

Location: [City, State]

About Vestas:

Vestas is the world leader in wind technology, manufacturing and selling wind turbines across the globe. We are committed to driving the transition to a sustainable energy future by providing innovative and reliable wind energy solutions.

Job Summary:

Vestas is seeking a highly motivated and talented Trainee Engineer to join our dynamic team. This role offers a unique opportunity to gain hands-on experience in the development and implementation of control solutions for wind turbines. The successful candidate will collaborate with experienced engineers, contribute to cutting-edge projects, and develop a strong foundation in wind energy technology.

Responsibilities:

  • Collaborate with Technical Leads on the design and development of turbine control solutions.
  • Understand, implement, and test control code changes according to established guidelines and best practices.
  • Participate actively in implementation and functional reviews, providing constructive feedback and insights.
  • Conduct thorough root cause analysis (RCA) on controller performance issues, identifying root causes and proposing effective solutions.
  • Develop innovative solutions for turbine enhancements, addressing non-standard product requests and service solutions.

Qualifications:

  • Master’s degree in Controls, Instrumentation & Controls, Mechatronics, Electro-mechanical, Electrical Engineering, or a related field with a strong emphasis on control systems.
  • 0-1 years of experience utilizing simulation/modeling tools such as MATLAB Simulink.
  • Demonstrated proficiency in mathematical modeling of electro-mechanical and hydraulic systems.
  • Solid understanding of control design principles and experience with model-based control approaches for tuning controllers.

Competencies:

  • Strong theoretical foundation in control theory and its practical applications.
  • Proficiency in programming languages including C++, SQL, R, and MATLAB.
  • Expertise in control system modeling, controller design, controller tuning, and controller verification techniques.
  • Good understanding of power generation concepts and principles.
  • Basic knowledge of aerodynamics relevant to wind turbine operation.
key_responsibility:
Trainee Engineer - Key Responsibilities at Vestas

This role focuses on developing and implementing control solutions for Vestas wind turbines.

Control System Development & Implementation:

  • Collaborate with Technical Leads: Work closely with experienced engineers to define and refine turbine control strategies. This involves actively participating in discussions, brainstorming sessions, and design reviews.
  • Understand, Implement, and Test Control Code Changes: Translate technical specifications into functional control code. This requires a deep understanding of programming languages (e.g., C++, MATLAB) and control system architectures. Thoroughly test implemented code changes to ensure they meet performance and safety standards.
  • Participate in Implementation and Functional Reviews: Actively contribute to internal reviews of control system designs and implementations. This involves presenting work, receiving feedback from peers and senior engineers, and iteratively improving designs based on collective insights.

Troubleshooting & Performance Optimization:

  • Conduct Root Cause Analysis (RCA) on Controller Performance Issues: Investigate and analyze performance issues in turbine control systems. This involves collecting data, identifying anomalies, and applying analytical techniques to pinpoint the root cause of the problem.
  • Provide Solutions for Controller Performance Issues: Develop and implement solutions to address identified performance issues. This may involve modifying existing code, designing new control algorithms, or proposing hardware modifications.

Innovation & Product Enhancement:

  • Develop Solutions for Turbine Enhancements: Contribute to the development of new features and enhancements for Vestas wind turbines. This could involve exploring innovative control strategies, optimizing existing functionalities, or addressing specific customer requirements.
  • Develop Solutions for Non-Standard Product Requests and Service Solutions: Collaborate with teams to develop customized control solutions for unique customer needs or service applications. This requires adaptability, problem-solving skills, and a willingness to explore unconventional approaches.
about_company:
About Vestas

Vestas is a global leader in sustainable energy solutions, specializing in the design, manufacture, installation, and service of wind turbines. With a strong commitment to innovation and environmental responsibility, Vestas has been at the forefront of the wind energy industry for over 75 years.

Mission and Vision:

Vestas' mission is to become the global leader in sustainable energy solutions by driving the transition to a world powered by wind energy. The company envisions a future where wind energy plays a central role in meeting global energy demands while minimizing environmental impact.

Culture and Values:

Vestas fosters a collaborative and inclusive work environment that values diversity, innovation, and integrity. The company's core values include:

  • Customer Focus: Delivering exceptional customer experiences through reliable products and services.
  • Innovation: Continuously pushing the boundaries of wind energy technology to create more efficient and sustainable solutions.
  • Teamwork: Empowering employees to work together effectively to achieve shared goals.
  • Sustainability: Operating responsibly and minimizing environmental impact throughout the entire value chain.

Market Position and Growth Trajectory:

Vestas holds a leading market share in the global wind energy sector, with a strong presence in both onshore and offshore wind markets. The company is actively expanding its operations in emerging markets, driven by the growing demand for clean energy solutions worldwide. Vestas' commitment to research and development ensures its continued leadership in the industry, with a focus on developing next-generation wind turbine technologies.
selection_process:
Vestas Trainee Engineer Hiring Workflow

This multi-stage process aims to identify candidates with the technical expertise, problem-solving skills, and collaborative spirit required for the Trainee Engineer role at Vestas.

1. Application Screening (1 week)

  • What happens: Resumes and cover letters are reviewed against pre-defined criteria focusing on education, relevant experience, and technical skills.
  • Who's involved: HR team and hiring manager.
  • Duration: 1 week.
  • Evaluation criteria: Alignment with job description requirements, academic background, relevant projects, and demonstrated technical skills.
  • Candidate expectations: Submit a well-structured resume and compelling cover letter highlighting relevant experience and passion for the wind energy industry.

2. Online Assessment (2 weeks)

  • What happens: Shortlisted candidates complete an online assessment testing their technical knowledge in control systems, programming, and problem-solving.
  • Who's involved: Candidates and an automated assessment platform.
  • Duration: 2 weeks (candidates have flexible time to complete the assessment).
  • Evaluation criteria: Accuracy, speed, and understanding of control theory concepts, programming logic, and analytical skills.
  • Candidate expectations: Prepare for technical questions related to control systems, programming languages mentioned in the job description, and problem-solving scenarios.

3. Technical Interview (1 week)

  • What happens: Top-performing candidates participate in a technical interview with a senior engineer, focusing on their understanding of control systems, relevant projects, and problem-solving approach.
  • Who's involved: Candidate and a senior engineer from the relevant department.
  • Duration: 1 week (scheduling flexibility provided).
  • Evaluation criteria: Depth of technical knowledge, ability to articulate complex concepts, problem-solving skills, and alignment with Vestas' engineering principles.
  • Candidate expectations: Prepare to discuss technical projects in detail, demonstrate their understanding of control systems, and showcase their problem-solving abilities.

4. Cultural Fit Interview (1 week)

  • What happens: Final candidates participate in a cultural fit interview with an HR representative or hiring manager, assessing their communication skills, teamwork abilities, and alignment with Vestas' values.
  • Who's involved: Candidate and an HR representative or hiring manager.
  • Duration: 1 week (scheduling flexibility provided).
  • Evaluation criteria: Communication style, teamwork skills, cultural fit, and enthusiasm for the role and Vestas' mission.
  • Candidate expectations: Be prepared to discuss their work style, team experiences, and how their values align with Vestas' culture.

5. Offer and Onboarding (2 weeks)

  • What happens: The selected candidate receives a formal job offer outlining compensation, benefits, and start date. Successful onboarding procedures are initiated.
  • Who's involved: HR team and hiring manager.
  • Duration: 2 weeks.
  • Evaluation criteria: Candidate acceptance of the offer and successful completion of onboarding procedures.
  • Candidate expectations: Review the offer carefully, negotiate if necessary, and actively participate in the onboarding process.

qualification:
Typical Qualifications & Requirements

While specific qualifications may vary depending on the company and role, here's a breakdown of common requirements for a position with the title "Not Specified":

I. Education & Experience

  • Bachelor's Degree: A bachelor's degree in a relevant field (e.g., business, marketing, communications, technology) is typically expected. This foundational education provides a broad understanding of core concepts and principles applicable to various roles.
  • Relevant Work Experience: 2-5 years of experience in a related field is often required. This demonstrates practical application of knowledge and skills, showcasing the candidate's ability to handle real-world challenges and contribute effectively.

II. Technical Skills

  • Microsoft Office Suite: Proficiency in Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook is essential for most roles. These tools are widely used for communication, document creation, data analysis, and project management.
  • Communication & Collaboration Tools: Familiarity with platforms like Slack, Zoom, or Microsoft Teams is increasingly important for remote and hybrid work environments. These tools facilitate seamless communication and collaboration within teams.
  • Data Analysis Tools (Optional): Depending on the specific role, experience with tools like Google Analytics, SQL, or Tableau may be beneficial. These tools enable data-driven decision making and performance tracking.

III. Soft Skills

  • Strong Communication Skills: Excellent written and verbal communication is crucial for conveying ideas clearly, collaborating effectively, and building relationships.
  • Problem-Solving & Critical Thinking: The ability to analyze situations, identify solutions, and make sound judgments is essential for navigating challenges and driving results.
  • Time Management & Organization: Prioritizing tasks, managing deadlines, and staying organized are critical for individual productivity and team success.
  • Adaptability & Flexibility: The ability to adjust to changing priorities, learn new things quickly, and embrace new challenges is highly valued in today's dynamic work environment.

Remember, these are general qualifications. Specific requirements will vary based on the company, industry, and individual job description.
job_description:
Software Engineer

About the Role

This is an exciting opportunity to join a dynamic and innovative team of software engineers. The ideal candidate will be a passionate and skilled developer with a strong understanding of software development principles and a proven track record of delivering high-quality software solutions.

Responsibilities

  • Design, develop, and implement new software features and functionalities.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams (product, design, QA) to ensure successful project delivery.
  • Write clean, well-documented, and maintainable code.
  • Participate in code reviews and provide constructive feedback to peers.
  • Troubleshoot and resolve software defects.
  • Stay up-to-date with the latest technologies and industry best practices.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related field.
  • 3+ years of professional experience in software development.
  • Proficiency in one or more programming languages (e.g., Java, Python, C++).
  • Experience with relational databases (e.g., MySQL, PostgreSQL).
  • Familiarity with agile development methodologies.
  • Excellent communication and problem-solving skills.

Bonus Points

  • Experience with cloud computing platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure).
  • Contributions to open-source projects.
  • Experience with DevOps practices.

Benefits

The company offers a competitive salary and benefits package, including health insurance, paid time off, and professional development opportunities.

selection_process:
Comprehensive Hiring Workflow

This multi-stage hiring workflow outlines a typical process for a variety of roles and industries.

1. Application Screening (3-5 business days)

  • What happens: Candidates submit applications through the job portal. Recruiters review resumes and cover letters, filtering based on essential qualifications and experience.
  • Who's involved: Recruiters/Hiring Managers
  • Duration: 3-5 business days
  • Evaluation criteria: Relevance of experience, skills, education, and cultural fit.
  • Candidate expectations: Submit a complete and tailored application highlighting relevant skills and experience.

2. Phone Screening (1-2 business days)

  • What happens: Short phone calls with shortlisted candidates to assess communication skills, basic qualifications, and interest in the role.
  • Who's involved: Recruiters
  • Duration: 15-30 minutes per call
  • Evaluation criteria: Communication clarity, enthusiasm, and alignment with job requirements.
  • Candidate expectations: Be prepared to discuss their background and motivations for applying.

3. Skills Assessment (2-3 business days)

  • What happens: Candidates complete online assessments to evaluate technical skills, problem-solving abilities, or personality traits relevant to the role.
  • Who's involved: Recruiters/Hiring Managers
  • Duration: Varies depending on the assessment type (30 minutes to 2 hours)
  • Evaluation criteria: Performance on specific skills tests or simulations.
  • Candidate expectations: Dedicate sufficient time and effort to demonstrate their abilities.

4. In-Person Interview (1-2 weeks)

  • What happens: Face-to-face interviews with hiring managers and/or team members to delve deeper into qualifications, experience, and cultural fit.
  • Who's involved: Hiring Manager, Team Members
  • Duration: 45-60 minutes per interview
  • Evaluation criteria: Communication skills, problem-solving abilities, cultural fit, and alignment with company values.
  • Candidate expectations: Prepare thoughtful questions, dress professionally, and arrive on time.

5. Reference Checks (1-2 business days)

  • What happens: Contacting previous employers to verify employment history, performance, and character references.
  • Who's involved: Recruiters/Hiring Managers
  • Duration: 1-2 business days
  • Evaluation criteria: Confirmation of candidate's experience and work ethic.
  • Candidate expectations: Provide accurate contact information for references.

6. Offer and Onboarding (1-2 weeks)

  • What happens: The selected candidate receives a formal job offer, negotiates terms, and completes the onboarding process.
  • Who's involved: Recruiters/Hiring Managers, HR
  • Duration: 1-2 weeks
  • Evaluation criteria: Candidate's acceptance of the offer and successful completion of onboarding.
  • Candidate expectations: Review the offer carefully, negotiate terms if necessary, and actively participate in onboarding activities.

Technical Skills:

job_description:
Java Developer (Apprentice)

Company: CGI

Location: Bangalore, Karnataka

Department: Software Development

Employment Type: Apprenticeship

Job ID: J0525-0795

Experience Level: Fresher / Entry-Level

About the Role

CGI is seeking a highly motivated and enthusiastic Java Developer (Apprentice) to join our dynamic development team in Bangalore. This apprenticeship program offers a unique opportunity for recent graduates to gain hands-on experience in building robust and scalable applications while working alongside experienced engineers and technical leads.

The successful candidate will be involved in all stages of the software development lifecycle, from design and development to testing and deployment. This role provides a strong foundation in Java development best practices and exposure to cutting-edge technologies within a collaborative and supportive environment.

Primary Responsibilities

  • Develop clean, maintainable, and well-documented Java code adhering to established coding standards.
  • Contribute to the design, implementation, and testing of new application features, ensuring they meet functional and performance requirements.
  • Troubleshoot and resolve software-related issues, utilizing debugging tools and techniques to identify and fix defects.
  • Participate actively in code reviews, providing constructive feedback and learning from senior developers.
  • Collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams, including product managers, designers, and QA engineers, to define and implement new functionalities.
  • Stay abreast of evolving technologies and industry best practices in Java development, continuously seeking opportunities for professional growth.

Key Skills Required

  • Strong foundational understanding of core Java concepts, object-oriented programming (OOP) principles, and data structures.
  • Exposure to Java frameworks such as Spring or Hibernate is highly desirable.
  • Basic understanding of relational databases like MySQL or PostgreSQL, including SQL query writing and database design principles.
  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to identify root causes and develop effective solutions.
  • Proven ability to work both independently and collaboratively within a team environment.
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills, enabling clear and concise communication with colleagues and stakeholders.

Eligibility Criteria

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related discipline.
  • Graduation Year: 2023 or 2024
  • Minimum aggregate percentage of 60% throughout academic career.

Technical Competencies

  • Java Programming
  • Microservices Architecture
  • Analytical Thinking
key_responsibility:

This section outlines the primary duties and responsibilities expected of a Java Developer (Apprentice) at CGI.

Software Development

  • Code Development:
    • Write clean, efficient, and well-documented Java code adhering to established coding standards and best practices.
    • Translate design specifications and user stories into functional Java code components.

  • Feature Implementation:

  • Issue Resolution:

    • Troubleshoot and resolve software-related issues reported by users or identified during testing.

Team Collaboration & Learning

    • Review code written by other team members, identifying areas for optimization and potential issues.
  • Team Communication:

    • Communicate effectively with team members, project managers, and stakeholders regarding project progress, challenges, and solutions.
  • Continuous Learning:
    • Stay abreast of evolving Java technologies, frameworks, and development best practices.
    • Seek opportunities to learn new skills and expand knowledge base through online resources, training programs, and mentorship.

This comprehensive list of responsibilities provides a clear understanding of the expectations for a Java Developer (Apprentice) at CGI.
about_company:
About CGI

CGI is a global leader in IT and business consulting services, with over 80,000 professionals across the globe. Driven by the belief that progress is powered by people, CGI partners with clients to design, build, and deliver innovative solutions for complex business challenges.

Mission and Values:

The company is guided by a strong set of values, including integrity, collaboration, and client focus. These values are embedded in CGI's culture and drive its commitment to delivering exceptional service and building long-term relationships with clients.

CGI's commitment to innovation and its focus on emerging technologies, such as artificial intelligence and cloud computing, position it for continued success in the rapidly evolving technology landscape.
