job_description:
Software Engineer – Apprentice at Trellix

About Trellix

Trellix is a global cybersecurity company dedicated to protecting organizations from evolving cyber threats.

Role Summary

The Software Engineer – Apprentice program is a 12-month immersive experience designed to equip individuals with a comprehensive understanding of Trellix's operations and provide hands-on experience with cutting-edge products and technologies. This program offers a structured learning path with dedicated mentorship and real-world project involvement, fostering the development of essential software engineering skills.

Position Responsibilities

  • Code Development: Write clean, maintainable, and well-documented code that adheres to functional and quality standards. Apply object-oriented principles and design patterns to create scalable and manageable solutions.
  • Collaboration and Quality Assurance: Participate actively in code reviews, collaborate with senior developers, and contribute to continuous improvement initiatives. Create unit tests to ensure code reliability and assist QA engineers in developing automated tests.
  • Platform Expertise: Adhere to established engineering protocols to ensure software quality and contribute to platform innovation across Windows and Linux environments.
  • Automation and Cloud Integration: Build and maintain automation frameworks using Python or similar technologies. Operate within virtual environments such as VMware Workstation or ESX Server. Engage with cloud services (e.g., AWS), integrate security testing, and contribute to cloud-based development initiatives.
  • Teamwork and Best Practices: Collaborate with global engineering, operations, and security teams to ensure adherence to best practices in solution design. Create, document, and continuously enhance internal tools and automated systems for code deployment and lifecycle management on cloud infrastructure.

Candidate Profile

  • Technical Proficiency: Proficient in programming languages such as Python, Java, or C++. Strong understanding of data structures, relational databases, networking principles, and operating systems.
  • Development Tool Familiarity: Experience with development tools like Visual Studio, debuggers, and system analysis utilities.
  • Communication and Collaboration: Clear and effective communication skills, with the ability to adapt, collaborate, and influence across teams.
  • Analytical Mindset: Strong analytical mindset with the ability to dissect complex systems and provide actionable insights.
  • Cybersecurity Awareness: Knowledge of cybersecurity fundamentals and experience with dynamic analysis tools is a plus.
  • Cloud Exposure: Exposure to AWS or other cloud environments is desirable.
  • Machine Learning Interest: Interest or experience in machine learning is an added advantage.

Educational and Experience Requirements

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, IT, or a related discipline.
  • Academic performance with a CGPA of 7.5 or higher.

What to Expect During the Apprenticeship

  • Mentorship and Feedback: Receive direct mentorship and constructive feedback from experienced leaders within Trellix.
  • Business and Technical Exposure: Gain exposure to foundational business processes and the technical ecosystems that drive Trellix's success.
  • Real-World Project Application: Apply academic knowledge and prior experience to real-world projects aligned with Trellix's strategic objectives.

selection_process:
Trellix Software Engineer – Apprentice Hiring Workflow

This multi-stage process aims to identify candidates with strong technical aptitude, collaborative spirit, and a passion for cybersecurity.

1. Application Screening (1 week)

  • What happens: Candidates submit resumes and cover letters through the Trellix career portal. The AI-powered system automatically screens applications based on keywords, skills, and experience matching the job description.
  • Who's involved: AI-powered applicant tracking system (ATS), HR team.
  • Duration: 1 week.
  • Evaluation criteria: Technical skills (programming languages, databases, operating systems), academic performance, relevant projects, and alignment with desired behavioral attributes.
  • Candidate expectations: Submit a well-structured resume and cover letter highlighting relevant skills and experiences.

2. Online Coding Assessment (2 weeks)

  • What happens: Shortlisted candidates complete a timed online coding assessment platform (e.g., HackerRank, Codility) testing their problem-solving abilities and proficiency in specific programming languages.
  • Who's involved: Candidates, online assessment platform.
  • Duration: 2 weeks (including submission and review time).
  • Evaluation criteria: Code quality, efficiency, adherence to best practices, and problem-solving approach.
  • Candidate expectations: Prepare for coding challenges and practice problem-solving techniques.

3. Technical Interview (1 week)

  • What happens: Top-performing candidates participate in a technical interview with a senior software engineer. The interview focuses on in-depth technical knowledge, understanding of software development principles, and experience with relevant technologies.
  • Who's involved: Candidate, senior software engineer.
  • Duration: 1 week (including scheduling and interview).
  • Evaluation criteria: Technical expertise, problem-solving skills, communication, and ability to articulate technical concepts clearly.
  • Candidate expectations: Prepare to discuss technical projects, demonstrate coding knowledge, and answer in-depth questions about software development methodologies.

4. Behavioral Interview (1 week)

  • What happens: Candidates participate in a behavioral interview with an HR representative or hiring manager. This interview assesses their soft skills, cultural fit, and alignment with Trellix's values.
  • Who's involved: Candidate, HR representative or hiring manager.
  • Duration: 1 week (including scheduling and interview).
  • Evaluation criteria: Communication skills, teamwork, adaptability, problem-solving approach, and cultural fit.
  • Candidate expectations: Prepare to discuss past experiences, provide examples of teamwork and problem-solving, and demonstrate alignment with Trellix's values.

5. Final Decision and Offer (1 week)

  • What happens: The hiring team reviews all interview feedback and makes a final decision. The selected candidate receives a formal job offer outlining the terms and conditions of employment.
  • Who's involved: Hiring team, HR department.
  • Duration: 1 week.
  • Evaluation criteria: Overall performance across all stages, alignment with role requirements, and cultural fit.
  • Candidate expectations: Be prepared to negotiate the offer and make a decision within a reasonable timeframe.

  • Relevant coursework: Courses in object-oriented programming, data structures and algorithms, software design patterns, databases, and operating systems are highly desirable.

Technical Skills:

  • Proficiency in at least one programming language: IQVIA utilizes various programming languages, so proficiency in a language like Java, Python, or C++ is crucial. The specific language requirement may vary depending on the team and project.
  • Basic understanding of software development lifecycle (SDLC): Familiarity with SDLC methodologies like Agile or Waterfall is important for collaborating effectively within development teams and understanding project workflows.
  • Database fundamentals: Knowledge of relational databases (e.g., SQL) and basic database concepts like querying, indexing, and normalization is beneficial for working with data-driven applications.
  • Version control systems: Experience with Git or similar version control systems is essential for managing code changes, collaborating with others, and tracking project history.

Soft Skills:

  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills: Software engineers need to be able to identify and solve complex technical problems effectively.
  • Excellent communication and teamwork skills: Collaboration is key in software development, so the ability to communicate clearly and work effectively in a team environment is crucial.
  • Adaptability and willingness to learn: The technology landscape is constantly evolving, so a willingness to learn new technologies and adapt to changing requirements is essential.

These qualifications provide a strong foundation for a successful career as a Trainee Software Engineer at IQVIA.
job_description:
Trainee Software Engineer at IQVIA

About IQVIA

IQVIA is a leading global provider of advanced analytics, technology solutions, and clinical research services to the life sciences industry. We are dedicated to using data and technology to accelerate the discovery, development, and delivery of innovative healthcare solutions.

Job Summary

IQVIA is seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Trainee Software Engineer to join our growing team. This role provides an excellent opportunity to gain hands-on experience in the development and maintenance of clinical systems, contributing to the advancement of healthcare through data-driven solutions. The Trainee Software Engineer will work collaboratively with experienced professionals, supporting the design, testing, and documentation of databases, and participating in the implementation and maintenance of clinical database systems.

Key Responsibilities

  • Database Development and Maintenance: Assist in the design, testing, and documentation of databases, adhering to established programming and validation standards. Contribute to the creation and management of databases for local, regional, or international clinical trials.
  • System Support and Implementation: Participate in the planning, design, and support of clinical database systems, including their implementation and ongoing maintenance. Assist with data transfers and database modifications for both internal teams and external clients.
  • Technology Evaluation and Research: Support IT teams in evaluating system upgrades or new technology solutions, contributing to the selection and implementation of innovative tools to enhance clinical data management processes.
  • Collaboration and Communication: Follow standard operating procedures and comply with internal guidelines. Achieve assigned objectives and collaborate effectively with project teams on timelines, tasks, and deliverables. Maintain clear communication and build strong working relationships with the Clinical Data Management team.

Qualifications

  • Education and Experience: Minimum of a high school diploma or equivalent, along with at least 3 years of relevant experience, or a comparable mix of education and professional background.
  • Technical Skills: Basic understanding of relational databases (e.g., SQL) is preferred.
  • Soft Skills: Strong organizational and communication abilities. Detail-oriented with a flexible and responsible approach to work. Capable of building effective working relationships with peers, leadership, and clients.
key_responsibility:
Key Responsibilities: Trainee Software Engineer at IQVIA

This role focuses on providing technical support for the development and maintenance of clinical systems, with a particular emphasis on database management.

Database Development and Management:

  • Database Design, Testing, and Documentation:

    • Collaborate with senior engineers to design, develop, and test databases for clinical applications.
    • Ensure adherence to established programming standards and validation protocols.
    • Create comprehensive documentation for database structures, functionalities, and usage guidelines.
    • Expected Outcome: Well-structured, functional, and documented databases that meet clinical data management requirements.

  • Database System Support:

    • Participate in the planning, design, and implementation of clinical database systems.
    • Assist in the ongoing maintenance and troubleshooting of existing database systems.
    • Contribute to the development of strategies for database optimization and performance enhancement.
    • Expected Outcome: Robust and efficient clinical database systems that support data integrity and accessibility.

  • Data Management and Transfer:

    • Assist with data transfers between different systems and databases.
    • Perform database modifications based on internal and external client requirements.
    • Ensure data accuracy and consistency during transfer and modification processes.
    • Expected Outcome: Seamless data flow and accurate data representation across various systems.

Technology Evaluation and Collaboration:

  • System Upgrade Evaluation:

    • Support IT teams in evaluating potential upgrades for existing clinical systems.
    • Analyze the impact of upgrades on database structures and functionalities.
    • Contribute to the selection and implementation of appropriate system upgrades.
    • Expected Outcome: Upgraded systems that enhance functionality, security, and performance.

  • Teamwork and Communication:

    • Collaborate effectively with project teams, adhering to timelines, tasks, and deliverables.
    • Maintain clear and consistent communication with the Clinical Data Management team.
    • Foster strong working relationships with peers, leadership, and external clients.
    • Expected Outcome: Successful project completion and efficient knowledge sharing within the team.

Compliance and Standards:

  • Adherence to Procedures:
    • Follow established standard operating procedures and internal guidelines.
    • Ensure compliance with relevant regulations and industry best practices.
    • Expected Outcome: Consistent and compliant data management practices.

This comprehensive list of responsibilities provides a clear understanding of the tasks and expectations for a Trainee Software Engineer at IQVIA.

About IQVIA

IQVIA is a leading global provider of advanced analytics, technology solutions, and clinical research services to the life sciences industry. selection_process:
IQVIA Trainee Software Engineer Hiring Workflow

This multi-stage process aims to identify candidates with the technical aptitude, soft skills, and cultural fit necessary to thrive as a Trainee Software Engineer at IQVIA.

1. Application Screening (1 week)

  • What happens: Resumes and cover letters are reviewed against the job description's qualifications and key responsibilities.
  • Who's involved: HR team and hiring manager.
  • Duration: 1 week.
  • Evaluation criteria: Education, relevant experience, technical skills (database knowledge is a plus), communication skills, and alignment with IQVIA's values.
  • Candidate expectations: Submit a well-structured resume and a compelling cover letter highlighting relevant skills and experiences.

2. Phone Interview (1 week)

  • What happens: A 30-minute phone interview with an HR representative or recruiter to assess communication skills, personality, and basic technical understanding.
  • Who's involved: HR representative or recruiter.
  • Duration: 30 minutes.
  • Evaluation criteria: Communication clarity, enthusiasm, problem-solving aptitude, and alignment with company culture.
  • Candidate expectations: Prepare for behavioral questions and be ready to discuss technical concepts briefly.

3. Technical Assessment (2 weeks)

  • What happens: Candidates complete a technical assessment, potentially including coding challenges, database queries, or system design exercises.
  • Who's involved: Hiring manager or technical team member.
  • Duration: 2 weeks (including submission and review time).
  • Evaluation criteria: Problem-solving skills, coding proficiency, database knowledge, and understanding of software development principles.
  • Candidate expectations: Demonstrate technical skills relevant to the role and follow instructions carefully.

4. In-Person Interview (1 week)

  • What happens: A 1-hour in-person interview with the hiring manager and potentially other team members to delve deeper into technical skills, experience, and cultural fit.
  • Who's involved: Hiring manager and team members.
  • Duration: 1 hour.
  • Evaluation criteria: Technical expertise, communication skills, teamwork abilities, problem-solving approach, and cultural alignment.
  • Candidate expectations: Prepare for in-depth technical discussions, behavioral questions, and the opportunity to ask questions about the role and company.

5. Decision and Offer (1 week)

  • What happens: The hiring team reviews all assessment results and makes a final decision. A job offer is extended to the selected candidate.
  • Who's involved: Hiring manager and HR team.
  • Duration: 1 week.
  • Evaluation criteria: Overall performance throughout the process, alignment with company needs, and potential for growth.
  • Candidate expectations: Receive a formal job offer outlining compensation, benefits, and start date.

job_description:
Developer I – Enterprise Solutions

About UST

UST is a leading digital transformation solutions company that helps global businesses navigate the complexities of change and innovation. With a strong focus on customer success, UST leverages its deep industry expertise, cutting-edge technologies, and global delivery capabilities to empower businesses to achieve their strategic objectives.

Job Summary

UST is seeking a highly motivated and talented Developer I – Enterprise Solutions to join our growing team. In this role, you will play a crucial part in the design, development, and implementation of innovative software solutions for our clients. You will work closely with experienced developers, architects, and project managers to deliver high-quality solutions that meet business requirements and exceed customer expectations.

Responsibilities

  • Participate in the full software development lifecycle, from requirements gathering and design to development, testing, and deployment.
  • Develop and maintain code in accordance with established coding standards and best practices.
  • Conduct thorough testing and debugging to ensure the quality and stability of software applications.
  • Collaborate effectively with team members to resolve technical challenges and deliver solutions on time and within budget.
  • Stay abreast of emerging technologies and industry trends to contribute to the continuous improvement of our development processes.
  • Document code and technical specifications clearly and concisely.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
  • 0-1 years of experience in software development.
  • Strong understanding of object-oriented programming principles.
  • Proficiency in at least one programming language (e.g., Java, Python, C#).
  • Familiarity with relational databases and SQL.
  • Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience with Agile development methodologies.
  • Knowledge of cloud computing platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure).
  • Familiarity with version control systems (e.g., Git).
key_responsibility:
Developer I – Enterprise Solutions: Key Responsibilities

System Administration & Configuration:

  • SAP System Setup & Maintenance:
    • Install, configure, and maintain SAP software components, including NetWeaver, HANA, and Solution Manager, ensuring optimal performance and stability.
    • Create and manage user accounts, roles, and authorizations within the SAP system, adhering to security best practices.
    • Implement and maintain system landscapes, including development, test, and production environments.
  • Database Management:
    • Administer and monitor SAP HANA, Oracle, and SQL Server databases, ensuring data integrity, availability, and performance.
    • Perform database backups, restores, and recovery procedures to safeguard critical data.
    • Optimize database performance through tuning, indexing, and query analysis.

System Monitoring & Support:

  • Performance Monitoring & Optimization:
    • Utilize monitoring tools to track system performance, identify bottlenecks, and implement solutions to enhance efficiency.
    • Analyze system logs and performance metrics to proactively identify potential issues and implement preventative measures.
  • Issue Resolution & Troubleshooting:
    • Diagnose and resolve technical issues related to SAP system functionality, performance, and security.
    • Collaborate with cross-functional IT teams to troubleshoot complex problems and implement effective solutions.
    • Document and track system issues, resolutions, and known errors.

System Upgrades & Maintenance:

  • Patch Management:
    • Apply SAP software patches and updates to ensure system security and stability.
    • Evaluate and implement new SAP releases and upgrades, ensuring compatibility and minimal disruption to business operations.
  • System Documentation:
    • Maintain accurate and up-to-date documentation for system configurations, processes, and procedures.
    • Create and update user guides and training materials for SAP system users.

selection_process:
UST Hiring Workflow: Developer I – Enterprise Solutions

This multi-stage process aims to identify the best candidate for the Developer I – Enterprise Solutions role at UST.

1. Application Screening (Duration: 1-2 weeks)

  • Evaluation Criteria: Education, experience, technical skills (SAP, databases, operating systems), and soft skills (communication, teamwork).

2. Phone Interview (Duration: 3-5 days)

  • Who's Involved: HR representative or recruiter.
  • Evaluation Criteria: Communication clarity, enthusiasm, and alignment with the role's requirements.
  • Candidate Expectations: Be prepared to discuss their background, career goals, and technical skills.

3. Technical Assessment (Duration: 1 week)

  • What Happens: Candidates complete a technical assessment to evaluate their practical knowledge of SAP, databases, and related technologies. This may involve coding exercises, scenario-based questions, or online tests.
  • Who's Involved: Hiring manager or technical team member.
  • Evaluation Criteria: Technical proficiency, problem-solving abilities, and understanding of core concepts.
  • Candidate Expectations: Demonstrate their technical skills and ability to apply them to real-world scenarios.

4. In-Person Interview (Duration: 1-2 weeks)

  • What Happens: An in-depth interview with the hiring manager and potentially other team members to assess the candidate's technical expertise, soft skills, and cultural fit.
  • Who's Involved: Hiring manager, team members, and potentially HR representative.
  • Evaluation Criteria: Technical depth, communication skills, teamwork, problem-solving, and cultural alignment.

5. Reference Checks (Duration: 1-2 weeks)

6. Offer and Onboarding (Duration: 1-2 weeks)

This section outlines the typical qualifications and requirements for a Junior Software Engineer position at Unisys.

Education:

  • Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field: A strong foundation in computer science principles is essential for understanding software development methodologies, data structures, and algorithms.
  • Relevant coursework: Courses in object-oriented programming, data structures, algorithms, software design, and databases are highly desirable.

Technical Skills:

  • Programming Languages: Proficiency in at least one object-oriented programming language such as Java, Python, or C# is crucial. Juniors are expected to demonstrate strong coding skills, understanding of syntax, and ability to write clean, efficient code.
  • Software Development Methodologies: Familiarity with Agile development methodologies (Scrum, Kanban) is increasingly important in modern software development environments. Understanding concepts like sprints, stand-ups, and continuous integration is beneficial.

  • Basic Database Knowledge: Understanding of relational databases (e.g., SQL) and basic querying concepts is valuable for interacting with data and building data-driven applications.

Soft Skills:

  • Teamwork: The ability to work effectively in a team environment, contribute to shared goals, and learn from more experienced colleagues is essential.

job_description:
Junior Software Engineer - Unisys Innovation Program

About Unisys

Unisys is a global information technology company that provides innovative solutions and services to clients around the world. With a rich history of technological advancement, Unisys is committed to helping organizations achieve their business goals through cutting-edge technology and expertise.

Job Summary

Unisys is seeking a highly motivated and organized Junior Software Engineer to join the team supporting the Unisys Innovation Program (UIP). This role will play a crucial part in the successful execution of UIP Y16, a comprehensive program designed to foster innovation and technological development among students. The Junior Software Engineer will collaborate closely with the Program Manager and various stakeholders to ensure seamless program delivery, from initial ideation to the Grand Finale event.

Key Responsibilities

  • Program Coordination and Execution: Assist in coordinating and overseeing all aspects of UIP Y16, including key events like the NASSCOM Tech Series, Crusader Connect, Hackathon, and the Grand Finale (May 2025).
  • Innovation Portal Management: Manage the Unisys Innovation Portal, ensuring its functionality and accessibility for participants.
  • Mentorship Program Support: Assign student abstracts to mentors, facilitate communication between mentors and student teams, and monitor the progress of the mentoring and evaluation stages.
  • Stakeholder Engagement: Support the Program Manager in engaging with stakeholders involved in associated events, ensuring smooth coordination and collaboration.
  • Event Management: Contribute to the organization and execution of the Tech Confluence and Grand Finale events, adhering to timelines, budgets, and deliverables outlined in the UIP Playbook and SOPs.
  • Documentation and Reporting: Maintain accurate records, generate reports, and contribute to program documentation.

Qualifications and Skills

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field is required; a Master's degree is preferred.
  • Prior experience in organizing and managing projects, programs, technical contests, or similar initiatives is highly desirable.
  • Strong project management skills with the ability to handle multiple tasks and deadlines effectively.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to engage effectively with students, mentors, and corporate stakeholders.
  • Familiarity with emerging technology trends, including AI, IoT, Immersive Experiences, and Quantum Computing.
  • Collaborative mindset and ability to thrive in a dynamic, cross-functional team environment.
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Advanced Excel), SharePoint, and data analysis platforms such as Power BI.
key_responsibility:
Jr Software Engineer - Unisys

Program Management & Execution

  • Unisys Innovation Program (UIP) Coordination:

    • Collaborate with the Program Manager to plan and execute the UIP, including key events like NASSCOM Tech Series, Crusader Connect, Hackathon, and others.
    • Manage the Unisys Innovation Portal, ensuring its functionality and accessibility for participants.
    • Assign student abstracts to mentors based on expertise and project alignment.
    • Oversee the mentoring and evaluation stages of the UIP, ensuring adherence to timelines, SLAs, schedules, and deliverables outlined in the UIP Playbook and SOPs.

selection_process:
Unisys Jr. Software Engineer Selection Process

This multi-stage process aims to identify candidates with the necessary skills, experience, and cultural fit for the Jr. Software Engineer role at Unisys.

1. Application Review (1 week)

  • What happens: Candidates submit resumes and cover letters through the Unisys career portal. The recruitment team reviews applications, screening for relevant qualifications, experience, and alignment with the job description.
  • Who's involved: Recruitment team, hiring manager.
  • Duration: 1 week.
  • Evaluation criteria: Education, relevant experience, technical skills, communication skills, and cultural fit.
  • Candidate expectations: Submit a well-structured resume and cover letter highlighting relevant skills and experience.

2. Online Assessment (2 days)

  • What happens: Shortlisted candidates complete an online assessment testing their technical skills (e.g., coding, problem-solving) and soft skills (e.g., communication, teamwork).
  • Who's involved: Candidates, online assessment platform.
  • Duration: 2 days.
  • Evaluation criteria: Technical proficiency, problem-solving abilities, communication skills, and teamwork aptitude.
  • Candidate expectations: Prepare for technical coding challenges and situational judgment questions.

3. Phone Interview (1 week)

  • What happens: Candidates selected from the assessment stage participate in a phone interview with a recruiter or hiring manager. This stage focuses on understanding the candidate's background, motivations, and fit for the role and company culture.
  • Who's involved: Candidate, recruiter or hiring manager.
  • Duration: 30-45 minutes.
  • Evaluation criteria: Communication skills, problem-solving abilities, cultural fit, and enthusiasm for the role.
  • Candidate expectations: Prepare for behavioral questions and demonstrate strong communication skills.

4. Technical Interview (1 week)

  • What happens: Candidates who successfully complete the phone interview participate in a technical interview with a senior engineer or team lead. This stage delves deeper into the candidate's technical skills and experience, focusing on relevant technologies and problem-solving approaches.
  • Who's involved: Candidate, senior engineer or team lead.
  • Duration: 60-90 minutes.
  • Evaluation criteria: Technical expertise, problem-solving abilities, coding skills, and understanding of relevant technologies.
  • Candidate expectations: Prepare for technical coding challenges and in-depth discussions about relevant technologies.

5. Final Interview (1 week)

  • What happens: The final stage involves an interview with the hiring manager and potentially other key stakeholders. This stage focuses on assessing the candidate's overall fit for the team and company culture, discussing expectations, and answering any remaining questions.
  • Who's involved: Candidate, hiring manager, and potentially other stakeholders.
  • Duration: 60-90 minutes.
  • Evaluation criteria: Cultural fit, communication skills, leadership potential, and overall suitability for the role.
  • Candidate expectations: Prepare to discuss their career goals, motivations, and how they align with Unisys' values and mission.

6. Offer and Onboarding (2 weeks)

  • What happens: The selected candidate receives a formal job offer outlining compensation, benefits, and start date. Upon acceptance, the candidate undergoes onboarding procedures, including paperwork, introductions to the team, and initial training.
  • Who's involved: Candidate, HR team, hiring manager.
  • Duration: 2 weeks.

This comprehensive selection process ensures that Unisys hires the best-qualified candidates who possess the necessary skills, experience, and cultural fit to contribute to the company's success.

job_description:
Software Engineer - AI & Automation

Company: AT&T

Location: Bangalore, Karnataka, India

Employment Type: Temporary (Fixed Term)

Work Schedule: 40 hours per week

About the Role:

AT&T is seeking a talented Software Engineer to join our team in Bangalore. This is a temporary, fixed-term position focused on integrating Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Generative AI capabilities into automation projects. The ideal candidate will possess a strong foundation in Python programming and a passion for exploring cutting-edge technologies.

Responsibilities:

  • Design, develop, and implement AI-powered automation solutions using Python.
  • Leverage Generative AI techniques to enhance existing automation workflows.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and translate them into technical specifications.
  • Conduct research and stay abreast of the latest advancements in AI and Generative AI.
  • Contribute to the development and maintenance of technical documentation.

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.
  • Proven experience in Python programming, including object-oriented design principles.
  • Foundational understanding of Artificial Intelligence concepts and algorithms.
  • Familiarity with Generative AI models and their applications.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Excellent communication and collaboration abilities.
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
  • Flexibility to adapt to changing priorities and work flexible hours as needed.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience with AI/ML frameworks such as TensorFlow or PyTorch.
  • Knowledge of cloud computing platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP).
  • Experience in developing and deploying automation solutions.
key_responsibility:
Key Responsibilities: Software Engineer (AI & Automation) - AT&T

AI Integration & Development:

  • Design and implement AI-powered solutions: Develop algorithms and models leveraging Python and AI/Generative AI principles to automate tasks and enhance existing processes within AT&T. This includes identifying areas for automation, analyzing data requirements, and building robust AI models.
  • Integrate AI functionalities into automation projects: Seamlessly incorporate AI-driven components into existing automation workflows, ensuring smooth data flow and efficient execution. This may involve working with APIs, integrating with existing systems, and optimizing AI model performance within the automation context.
  • Stay abreast of AI advancements: Continuously research and evaluate emerging AI technologies and techniques, particularly in the realm of Generative AI, to identify opportunities for innovation and improvement within AT&T's automation initiatives.

Software Engineering Best Practices:

  • Write clean, efficient, and well-documented code: Adhere to coding standards and best practices to ensure code readability, maintainability, and scalability. This includes utilizing version control systems, writing comprehensive unit tests, and documenting code effectively.
  • Collaborate effectively with team members: Work closely with other engineers, product managers, and stakeholders to understand requirements, discuss design choices, and ensure successful project delivery. This involves clear communication, active listening, and a willingness to contribute to team goals.
  • Troubleshoot and debug code: Identify and resolve issues within the developed codebase, utilizing debugging tools and techniques to pinpoint root causes and implement effective solutions. This requires analytical thinking, problem-solving skills, and a strong understanding of software development principles.

Note: This list is based on the provided information and industry standards for Software Engineer roles. Specific responsibilities may vary depending on the project and team requirements.
about_company:
About AT&T

A Legacy of Innovation, A Future of Connectivity

AT&T is a global leader in communications, connecting people and businesses with the world through its vast network of fiber optic cables, wireless towers, and advanced technologies. With a rich history spanning over 140 years, AT&T has consistently pushed the boundaries of innovation, from pioneering the telephone to leading the charge in 5G and fiber broadband.

Driving the Future of Connectivity

AT&T is committed to delivering a seamless and reliable connectivity experience for its customers. The company invests heavily in research and development, constantly exploring new technologies and solutions to meet the evolving needs of a connected world. This dedication to innovation has positioned AT&T as a key player in the development of next-generation networks, including 5G, which promises to revolutionize industries like healthcare, transportation, and entertainment.

A Culture of Collaboration and Growth

AT&T fosters a collaborative and inclusive work environment where employees are empowered to contribute their unique talents and perspectives. The company values diversity and believes that a strong team is built on the foundation of respect, innovation, and a shared commitment to excellence. AT&T offers a comprehensive benefits package and numerous opportunities for professional development, supporting its employees' growth and well-being.

Join the AT&T Team

As a Software Engineer at AT&T, you will play a vital role in shaping the future of connectivity. You will have the opportunity to work on cutting-edge projects, collaborate with talented engineers, and make a real impact on the world.
selection_process:
AT&T Software Engineer Selection Process

This multi-stage process aims to identify the best candidate for the Software Engineer role at AT&T, focusing on technical skills, adaptability, and AI/Generative AI knowledge.

1. Application Screening (1 week)

  • What happens: Candidates submit resumes and cover letters through the AT&T careers portal. The HR team reviews applications, filtering based on required skills (Python, AI/Generative AI), experience, and education.
  • Who's involved: HR team
  • Duration: 1 week
  • Evaluation criteria: Resume relevance to job description, technical skills, experience, education, and cover letter quality.
  • Candidate expectations: Submit a well-structured resume and cover letter highlighting relevant skills and experience.

2. Online Coding Assessment (2 days)

  • What happens: Shortlisted candidates complete an online coding assessment platform (e.g., HackerRank, Codility) testing their Python proficiency and problem-solving abilities.
  • Who's involved: HR team, Technical Hiring Manager
  • Duration: 2 days
  • Evaluation criteria: Code quality, efficiency, problem-solving approach, and adherence to best practices.
  • Candidate expectations: Prepare for coding challenges involving Python and demonstrate strong problem-solving skills.

3. Technical Interview (1 week)

  • What happens: Candidates selected from the coding assessment participate in a technical interview with a Software Engineer or Technical Hiring Manager. The interview focuses on Python expertise, AI/Generative AI understanding, and project experience.
  • Who's involved: Software Engineer/Technical Hiring Manager
  • Duration: 1 week (scheduling flexibility)
  • Evaluation criteria: Technical knowledge, problem-solving skills, communication, and ability to apply AI/Generative AI concepts.
  • Candidate expectations: Prepare to discuss technical projects, demonstrate Python knowledge, and articulate understanding of AI/Generative AI.

4. Cultural Fit Interview (1 week)

  • What happens: Candidates who successfully complete the technical interview participate in a cultural fit interview with an HR representative or team lead. This assesses their alignment with AT&T's values, work style, and team dynamics.
  • Who's involved: HR representative/Team Lead
  • Duration: 1 week (scheduling flexibility)
  • Evaluation criteria: Communication skills, teamwork, adaptability, and cultural fit.
  • Candidate expectations: Showcase their personality, communication style, and ability to collaborate effectively.

5. Decision and Offer (1 week)

  • What happens: The hiring team reviews all interview feedback and makes a final decision. The selected candidate receives a formal job offer outlining terms and conditions.
  • Who's involved: Hiring Manager, HR team
  • Duration: 1 week
  • Evaluation criteria: Overall performance across all stages, technical skills, cultural fit, and alignment with team needs.
  • Candidate expectations: Be prepared to negotiate the offer and accept or decline the position.

qualification:
Xerox IT/ITES Apprentice: Typical Qualifications & Requirements

This section outlines the typical qualifications and requirements for an IT/ITES Apprentice position at Xerox.

Education:

  • High School Diploma or Equivalent: A high school diploma or equivalent is the minimum educational requirement for this role. It demonstrates a foundational understanding of basic concepts and the ability to learn new information.
  • Relevant Associate's Degree (Preferred): While not mandatory, an associate's degree in computer science, information technology, or a related field is highly preferred. This provides a deeper understanding of IT principles and can give the apprentice a competitive edge.

Technical Skills:

  • Basic Computer Literacy: Proficiency in using common computer applications such as word processing, spreadsheets, and email is essential. The apprentice will be interacting with various software systems and need to navigate them effectively.
  • Networking Fundamentals: A basic understanding of networking concepts like IP addresses, DNS, and network topologies is beneficial. This knowledge will be helpful in troubleshooting network issues and understanding how IT systems are interconnected.
  • Operating System Knowledge: Familiarity with common operating systems like Windows and Linux is desirable. The apprentice may be tasked with installing, configuring, and troubleshooting these systems.
  • Troubleshooting Skills: The ability to identify and resolve technical issues is crucial. Apprentices will be involved in resolving user issues and identifying solutions to technical problems.

Soft Skills:

  • Communication Skills: Strong written and verbal communication skills are essential for interacting with colleagues, supervisors, and clients. The apprentice will need to clearly explain technical issues and solutions.
  • Problem-Solving Skills: The ability to analyze problems, identify root causes, and develop effective solutions is critical. Apprentices will encounter various technical challenges and need to think critically to find solutions.
  • Teamwork: The ability to work effectively as part of a team is important. Apprentices will collaborate with other IT professionals on projects and support tasks.
  • Adaptability: The IT field is constantly evolving, so the ability to learn new technologies and adapt to changing environments is essential.

These qualifications provide a framework for success as an IT/ITES Apprentice at Xerox.
job_description:
IT/ITES Apprentice at Xerox

Overview

Xerox is seeking motivated and tech-savvy individuals to join our IT/ITES Apprenticeship program. This immersive program offers a unique opportunity to gain hands-on experience in a dynamic IT environment, working alongside experienced professionals. Apprentices will actively participate in technology-driven projects, developing essential IT skills and gaining valuable insights into business operations and IT processes. This program is ideal for individuals seeking to launch their careers in the IT/ITES sector and build a strong foundation for future growth.

Primary Responsibilities

  • Skill Development: Participate in structured training sessions designed to build core IT skills, including software applications, networking fundamentals, and basic programming concepts.
  • Project Support: Collaborate with experienced team members on a variety of tasks, such as system administration, data management, technical support, and process improvement initiatives.
  • Technical Troubleshooting: Assist in identifying and resolving technical issues within systems or applications, working closely with colleagues to ensure smooth operations and minimize downtime.
  • Documentation: Contribute to the creation and maintenance of technical documentation, including user manuals, process guidelines, and troubleshooting guides, ensuring clear and concise information for internal use and knowledge sharing.
  • Data Handling: Participate in data-related tasks such as data entry, analysis, cleansing, and verification, ensuring data accuracy and integrity.
  • Client Interaction: Provide technical support to users and customers, addressing software, hardware, or access issues, and ensuring a positive service experience.
  • Compliance and Security: Adhere to internal security guidelines and compliance policies, safeguarding sensitive data and maintaining organizational integrity.
  • Continuous Learning: Stay abreast of industry trends and emerging technologies through self-directed learning and participation in professional development opportunities.

Eligibility and Required Skills

  • Bachelor's degree in a relevant field such as IT, Computer Science, or a related discipline.
  • Strong analytical thinking and problem-solving skills with a logical approach to technical challenges.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills for effective collaboration and documentation.
  • Ability to work both independently and as part of a team, demonstrating a strong work ethic and a willingness to learn.
  • Familiarity with databases, coding languages, or operating systems is a plus.
key_responsibility:
Xerox IT/ITES Apprentice: Key Responsibilities

This section outlines the core duties and responsibilities expected of an IT/ITES Apprentice at Xerox.

I. Technical Skill Development and Application

  • Participate in Training Programs: Actively engage in structured training sessions designed to build foundational IT skills and familiarize you with Xerox's IT/ITES workflows and processes. This includes learning about software applications, hardware systems, network infrastructure, and relevant industry best practices.

  • Project Support: Collaborate with experienced IT professionals on various projects, gaining hands-on experience in areas such as:

    • System Operations: Assist in the daily maintenance and management of IT systems, including servers, workstations, and network devices.
    • Data Handling: Contribute to tasks involving data entry, analysis, cleansing, and verification to ensure data accuracy and integrity.
    • Support Services: Provide technical assistance to internal users or customers, resolving software, hardware, or access issues.
    • Process Enhancements: Participate in initiatives to improve existing IT processes, identifying areas for optimization and contributing to solutions.

  • Technical Troubleshooting: Develop your problem-solving skills by assisting in identifying and resolving technical challenges within systems or applications. This involves analyzing error messages, conducting diagnostic tests, and collaborating with colleagues to implement effective solutions.

II. Documentation and Knowledge Sharing

  • Technical Documentation: Draft and update manuals, technical documents, and procedural guidelines for internal use and knowledge sharing. This ensures clear and concise documentation of IT processes, systems configurations, and troubleshooting procedures.

III. Client Interaction and Communication

  • User Support: Provide prompt and courteous assistance to users or customers experiencing technical difficulties. This involves understanding their issues, guiding them through troubleshooting steps, and escalating complex problems to senior team members.

IV. Compliance and Security

  • Adherence to Policies: Strictly follow internal security guidelines and compliance policies to ensure data confidentiality, integrity, and organizational security. This includes handling sensitive information responsibly and adhering to access control protocols.

V. Continuous Learning and Development

  • Stay Updated: Actively seek opportunities to learn about the latest industry developments and evolving technologies. This may involve attending webinars, reading technical publications, or pursuing relevant certifications to enhance your technical expertise and adaptability.

By fulfilling these responsibilities, the IT/ITES Apprentice will gain valuable hands-on experience, develop essential technical skills, and contribute to the smooth operation of Xerox's IT/ITES environment.
about_company:
About Xerox

Xerox is a global technology leader that has been transforming the way the world works for over 100 years. From its pioneering work in photocopying to its current focus on digital document workflows and managed print services, Xerox has consistently pushed the boundaries of innovation.

Mission and Values:

Xerox is driven by a mission to connect people and ideas through innovative technology solutions. The company's core values emphasize customer focus, integrity, teamwork, and continuous improvement. These values are reflected in Xerox's commitment to providing exceptional customer service, developing ethical and sustainable business practices, and fostering a collaborative and inclusive work environment.

Market Position and Growth Trajectory:

As a global leader in document technology, Xerox holds a strong market position in a rapidly evolving industry. The company is strategically focused on growth in key areas such as cloud computing, artificial intelligence, and cybersecurity. Xerox is actively investing in research and development to deliver cutting-edge solutions that address the evolving needs of its customers.

Culture and Opportunities:

Xerox fosters a culture of innovation, collaboration, and continuous learning. The company offers a wide range of opportunities for professional development and growth, including apprenticeships, mentorship programs, and tuition reimbursement. Xerox is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace where all employees feel valued and empowered to contribute their best.
selection_process:
Xerox IT/ITES Apprentice Hiring Workflow

This multi-stage process aims to identify candidates with the right technical aptitude, soft skills, and eagerness to learn.

1. Application Screening (Duration: 1 week)

  • What happens: Candidates submit resumes and cover letters through the Xerox careers portal.
  • Who's involved: HR team and hiring manager.
  • Evaluation criteria:
    • Alignment of educational background and skills with job requirements.
    • Relevant coursework or projects demonstrating technical understanding.
    • Strong communication skills evident in resume and cover letter.
  • Candidate expectations: Submit a well-structured resume highlighting relevant experience and skills, and a compelling cover letter expressing interest in the apprenticeship.

2. Online Assessment (Duration: 2 days)

  • What happens: Shortlisted candidates complete an online assessment testing technical knowledge (e.g., basic programming, networking concepts) and problem-solving abilities.
  • Who's involved: HR team and potentially an external assessment provider.
  • Evaluation criteria: Accuracy and speed in completing technical questions, logical reasoning, and analytical skills.
  • Candidate expectations: Prepare for a timed assessment covering fundamental IT concepts.

3. Virtual Interview (Duration: 30 minutes)

  • What happens: Top-performing candidates participate in a virtual interview with the hiring manager and potentially a team member.
  • Who's involved: Hiring manager, team member (optional), and candidate.
  • Evaluation criteria: Communication skills, enthusiasm, problem-solving approach, teamwork aptitude, and cultural fit.
  • Candidate expectations: Prepare for behavioral questions, technical inquiries, and questions about their career goals.

4. Final Interview (Duration: 1 hour)

  • What happens: Finalists are invited for an in-person or virtual interview with senior management.
  • Who's involved: Senior manager, hiring manager, and candidate.
  • Evaluation criteria: Leadership potential, strategic thinking, and alignment with Xerox's values.
  • Candidate expectations: Demonstrate a deep understanding of the role and Xerox's business, and articulate their long-term career aspirations.

5. Offer and Onboarding (Duration: 2 weeks)

  • What happens: Selected candidates receive a formal offer letter outlining the terms of employment. Successful candidates undergo onboarding procedures, including paperwork, training, and introductions to the team.
  • Who's involved: HR team, hiring manager, and new apprentice.

This comprehensive selection process ensures Xerox hires apprentices who possess the necessary technical skills, soft skills, and cultural fit to thrive in the IT/ITES environment.

qualification:
Citi Group Ops Support Specialist: Typical Qualifications & Requirements

This section outlines the typical qualifications and requirements for an Ops Support Specialist position at Citi Group.

I. Education & Experience

  • Bachelor's Degree: A bachelor's degree in a relevant field such as Business Administration, Finance, or Information Technology is generally preferred. This foundational education equips candidates with a broad understanding of business principles, financial concepts, and technical fundamentals, which are essential for supporting operational processes.
  • 1-3 Years of Experience: 1-3 years of experience in an operational support role, preferably within the financial services industry, is typically expected. This practical experience allows candidates to demonstrate their ability to handle operational tasks, troubleshoot issues, and interact with clients or internal stakeholders effectively.

II. Technical Skills

  • Microsoft Office Suite: Proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook is crucial for creating reports, analyzing data, communicating with colleagues, and managing schedules.
  • CRM Software: Familiarity with Customer Relationship Management (CRM) systems, such as Salesforce or Citi's internal CRM, is essential for managing customer interactions, tracking support requests, and maintaining accurate customer records.
  • Database Management: Basic understanding of database concepts and query languages (e.g., SQL) is beneficial for retrieving and analyzing operational data.

III. Soft Skills

  • Communication: Excellent written and verbal communication skills are vital for interacting with clients, colleagues, and management, both internally and externally.
  • Problem-Solving: The ability to identify, analyze, and resolve operational issues effectively is crucial for ensuring smooth workflow and customer satisfaction.
  • Teamwork: Ops Support Specialists often collaborate with colleagues from different departments, so strong teamwork skills are essential for successful project completion and knowledge sharing.
  • Attention to Detail: Accuracy and meticulousness are paramount when handling sensitive customer information and processing financial transactions.

These qualifications provide a framework for assessing candidates' suitability for an Ops Support Specialist role at Citi Group.
job_description:
Ops Support Specialist

Company: Citi Group

Location: [City, State]

About the Role:

The Ops Support Specialist is an entry-level position within Citi Group's Operations team. This role provides essential operational support services, ensuring smooth and efficient client interactions. The successful candidate will collaborate with various internal and external stakeholders, including operations staff, relationship managers, project managers, custodians, and clients.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Client Communication Management:
    • Analyze and document current and future state processes for Client Reports and Advices (CRAs), encompassing client communication letters, notices, and confirms.
    • Collaborate with Legal & Compliance teams to obtain necessary sign-offs on all regulatory business requirements related to CRAs.
  • Project Support:
    • Serve as the primary liaison between business stakeholders and technology teams, providing expert advice on options, risks, costs, prioritizations, and delivery timelines for projects.
    • Create and deliver engaging training sessions, webcast demos, and User Acceptance Test (UAT) scripts, ensuring clear understanding of project requirements.
    • Manage and maintain comprehensive project plans, acting as the project manager for follow-ups across various departments.
  • Client Delivery:
    • Contribute to the delivery of regulatory client deliverables, including legal statements, performance reporting, advices, letters, and notices.
    • Prioritize client needs and strive to deliver an exceptional client experience, adhering to established metrics.
  • Risk Management:
    • Demonstrate a strong understanding of risk assessment and its implications for business decisions.
    • Uphold Citigroup's reputation by adhering to applicable laws, rules, and regulations, demonstrating sound ethical judgment, and escalating control issues transparently.

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree/University degree or equivalent experience.
  • Previous experience in a similar operational support role is preferred.
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite.
  • General knowledge of client reporting practices across the financial industry.
  • Working knowledge of SQL environments and database queries.
  • Excellent organizational and time management skills.
  • Proven problem-solving and decision-making abilities.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills.
key_responsibility:
Ops Support Specialist - Key Responsibilities

Client Communication & Reporting:

  • Analyze and Document Client Reports: Review and document existing Client Reports and Advices (communication letters, notices, and confirms) to understand their current state and identify areas for improvement. This includes analyzing content, format, and delivery methods.
  • Create and Deliver Client Communication Materials: Develop new Client Reports and Advices based on business requirements and regulatory guidelines. This may involve drafting content, designing layouts, and ensuring accuracy and clarity.
  • Manage Client Reporting Projects: Lead projects focused on enhancing or implementing new client reporting processes. This includes defining project scope, timelines, and deliverables, coordinating with stakeholders, and tracking progress.

Operational Support & Collaboration:

  • Liaison Between Teams: Act as a primary point of contact between operations staff, relationship managers, project managers, custodians, and clients. Facilitate communication, resolve issues, and ensure smooth workflow.
  • Record & Documentation Management: Maintain accurate and up-to-date records and documentation related to client accounts, transactions, and communications. This includes ensuring proper storage, retrieval, and security of information.
  • Account Maintenance: Assist with opening and maintaining client accounts, ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements and internal procedures. This may involve verifying information, processing applications, and updating account details.

Project Management & Training:

  • Project Planning & Execution: Create and manage project plans for various initiatives, including timelines, budgets, and resource allocation. Track progress, identify risks, and implement mitigation strategies.
  • Training & Documentation: Develop and deliver training sessions, webcast demos, and user manuals to educate stakeholders on new processes, systems, and tools.
  • Testing & Quality Assurance: Create and execute User Acceptance Test (UAT) scripts and business scenarios to ensure the functionality and accuracy of new systems and processes.

Risk Management & Compliance:

  • Risk Assessment: Identify and assess potential risks associated with operational activities, ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements and internal policies.
  • Compliance Monitoring: Stay informed about relevant laws, regulations, and industry best practices to ensure adherence to Citigroup's compliance standards.
  • Ethical Conduct: Demonstrate ethical behavior and sound judgment in all business dealings, upholding Citigroup's reputation and values.
about_company:
About Citi

Citi, a global financial services leader, has a rich history spanning over two centuries. With a presence in over 160 countries and jurisdictions, Citi serves millions of customers, including corporations, governments, institutions, and individuals.

Mission and Values:

Citi is driven by a mission to enable progress and improve lives by connecting people and businesses to economic opportunity. The company's core values of integrity, respect, accountability, and excellence guide its operations and interactions with stakeholders worldwide.

Market Position and Growth:

Citi holds a prominent position in the global financial landscape, offering a comprehensive suite of services encompassing consumer banking, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, and wealth management. The company's strategic focus on emerging markets and digital innovation positions it for continued growth and expansion.

Culture and Employee Experience:

Citi fosters a diverse and inclusive workplace that values collaboration, innovation, and professional development. The company is committed to creating a supportive and empowering environment where employees can thrive and contribute to its success.
selection_process:
Citi Group: Ops Support Specialist Hiring Workflow

This multi-stage process aims to identify candidates with the necessary skills, experience, and cultural fit for the Ops Support Specialist role at Citi Group.

1. Application Screening (Duration: 1-2 weeks)

  • What happens: Candidates submit resumes and cover letters through the Citi Group career portal. Recruiters review applications based on pre-defined criteria, focusing on education, relevant experience, and key skills (Microsoft Office, SQL, communication).
  • Who's involved: Recruiters and hiring managers.
  • Evaluation criteria: Resume alignment with job description, relevant experience, skills, and education.
  • Candidate expectations: Submit a complete and compelling application highlighting relevant qualifications.

2. Phone Interview (Duration: 1 week)

  • What happens: Short phone interviews are conducted with shortlisted candidates to assess their communication skills, basic understanding of the role, and cultural fit.
  • Who's involved: Recruiters and/or hiring managers.
  • Evaluation criteria: Communication clarity, enthusiasm, problem-solving aptitude, and alignment with Citi Group values.
  • Candidate expectations: Prepare for behavioral questions and demonstrate strong communication skills.

3. Technical Assessment (Duration: 1 week)

  • What happens: Candidates complete a technical assessment to evaluate their proficiency in Microsoft Office, SQL, and database queries. This may involve practical exercises or scenario-based questions.
  • Who's involved: Recruiters and/or technical specialists.
  • Evaluation criteria: Accuracy, efficiency, and problem-solving skills demonstrated in the technical tasks.
  • Candidate expectations: Demonstrate technical skills relevant to the role and be prepared for hands-on exercises.

4. In-Person Interview (Duration: 1 week)

  • What happens: Shortlisted candidates participate in a face-to-face interview with the hiring manager and potentially other team members. This interview delves deeper into their experience, skills, and suitability for the role.
  • Who's involved: Hiring manager, team members, and potentially HR representatives.
  • Evaluation criteria: Technical expertise, problem-solving abilities, communication skills, teamwork, and cultural fit.
  • Candidate expectations: Prepare for in-depth discussions about their experience, skills, and career goals.

5. Reference Checks (Duration: 1 week)

  • What happens: References provided by the candidate are contacted to verify their experience, skills, and work ethic.
  • Who's involved: Recruiters and/or HR representatives.
  • Evaluation criteria: Confirmation of candidate's qualifications, work history, and character.
  • Candidate expectations: Provide accurate and up-to-date contact information for references.

6. Offer and Onboarding (Duration: 2 weeks)

  • What happens: The selected candidate receives a formal job offer outlining compensation, benefits, and start date. Successful completion of background checks and onboarding procedures leads to the candidate joining Citi Group.
  • Who's involved: Recruiters, HR representatives, and hiring manager.
  • Evaluation criteria: Candidate acceptance of the offer and successful completion of onboarding.
  • Candidate expectations: Review the offer carefully, negotiate if necessary, and complete all required onboarding steps.

job_description:
Intern – SC Live (Hindi) at ShareChat

About ShareChat

ShareChat is a leading social media platform in India, connecting people through engaging content and real-time interactions. With a focus on vernacular languages, ShareChat empowers users to express themselves authentically and build meaningful connections.

Job Summary

ShareChat is seeking a passionate and driven intern to join the SC Live team, focusing on the Hindi language segment. This role will play a crucial part in nurturing a thriving community of content creators and engaging users within the platform's live audio feature. The ideal candidate will possess strong communication skills, cultural insight, and a data-driven approach to optimize creator performance and user experience.

Key Responsibilities

  • Creator Outreach and Relationship Management: Identify and connect with promising Hindi content creators across platforms like ShareChat and similar sources. Develop and maintain ongoing relationships, guiding them through operational procedures and providing support.
  • Onboarding and Engagement: Support the onboarding and re-engagement of hosts for one-on-one interactions within the "Friendzone" feature, a dedicated space for private conversations and connection building.
  • Community Management: Share regular updates with the SC Live community and hosts regarding current events, promotional offers, incentive programs, and internal campaigns. Utilize various communication channels to ensure effective dissemination of information.
  • Social Media Engagement: Boost social media activity and audience interaction during internal contests and promotional drives, fostering a vibrant and engaged community.
  • Data Analysis and Insights: Analyze virtual gifting trends to assist creators in maximizing revenue through active audience participation. Leverage data to identify opportunities for growth and improvement.
  • Content Quality Assurance: Monitor content for appropriate language, review user profiles, manage direct messages, and ensure quality in notifications and feed interactions.
  • Cross-Functional Collaboration: Collaborate with teams across content and live audio segments to design, track, and evaluate performance metrics, contributing to the overall success of SC Live.

Ideal Candidate Profile

  • Experience: 0 to 2 years of relevant experience in creator relations or talent management, demonstrating strong communication skills and the ability to foster engaging environments.
  • Cultural Understanding: Deep cultural insight with the ability to understand regional preferences and content tastes quickly. A natural ability to connect with diverse audiences.
  • Data Proficiency: Comfortable working with data and proficient in Google Sheets or Excel. Working knowledge of formulas like VLOOKUP and Pivot Tables to extract insights from key metrics.
  • Language Skills: Proficient in English and at least one regional language, with strong reading, writing, and speaking skills.

Work Location: This is a remote (work-from-home) position.
key_responsibility:
Key Responsibilities: Intern – SC Live (Hindi)

This role focuses on supporting the growth and engagement of content creators within ShareChat's live audio platform, SC Live.

Content Creator Management

  • Talent Acquisition: Identify and connect with potential content creators specializing in Hindi content across ShareChat and similar platforms. This involves researching trending topics, analyzing creator profiles, and reaching out to promising candidates.
  • Relationship Building: Develop and nurture ongoing relationships with selected creators. This includes providing guidance on operational procedures, addressing queries, and offering support to ensure a smooth experience on the platform.
  • Onboarding and Re-engagement: Assist in onboarding new hosts for the "Friendzone" feature, a space for private conversations and connection building. This involves guiding them through the setup process, explaining features, and encouraging active participation. Re-engage existing hosts through personalized communication and incentives to maintain their involvement.

Community Management and Engagement

  • Communication and Updates: Disseminate regular updates to the SC Live community and hosts regarding platform news, promotional offers, incentive programs, and internal campaigns. Utilize various communication channels like email, in-app notifications, and community forums to ensure effective reach.
  • Social Media Amplification: Boost social media activity and audience interaction during internal contests and promotional drives. This involves creating engaging content, running targeted campaigns, and actively responding to user comments and queries.
  • Trend Analysis: Analyze virtual gifting trends within the SC Live platform to identify popular content formats and audience preferences. Share these insights with creators to help them optimize their content and increase revenue through active audience participation.

Quality Control and Collaboration

  • Content Moderation: Monitor content for appropriate language, review user profiles, and manage direct messages to ensure a safe and positive environment for all users.
  • Quality Assurance: Ensure quality in notifications and feed interactions by reviewing and addressing any issues or inconsistencies.
  • Cross-Functional Collaboration: Collaborate with teams across content and live audio segments to design, track, and evaluate performance metrics for SC Live. This involves providing data-driven insights and contributing to the development of strategies for platform growth and improvement.

qualification:
Graduate Trainee - Associate Monitoring Engineer: Qualifications & Requirements

This section outlines the typical qualifications and requirements for a Graduate Trainee - Associate Monitoring Engineer position at PayU.

Education:

  • Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field: A strong foundation in computer science principles is essential for understanding system architecture, network protocols, and software development methodologies. This degree provides the theoretical knowledge necessary to analyze system performance, troubleshoot issues, and implement monitoring solutions.

Technical Skills:

  • Linux/Unix Operating Systems: Proficiency in Linux/Unix environments is crucial as monitoring tools and systems are often deployed on these platforms. Candidates should be comfortable navigating the command line, managing user accounts, and understanding system logs.
  • Scripting Languages (e.g., Python, Bash): The ability to write scripts is essential for automating tasks, collecting data, and generating reports. Familiarity with at least one scripting language allows for efficient monitoring solution development and customization.
  • Networking Fundamentals: A basic understanding of networking concepts like TCP/IP, DNS, and firewalls is necessary to interpret network traffic data and identify potential bottlenecks.
  • Monitoring Tools: Exposure to popular monitoring tools like Nagios, Zabbix, Prometheus, or Grafana is highly desirable. Experience with these tools allows for effective system monitoring, alerting, and performance analysis.

Soft Skills:

  • Problem-solving and Analytical Skills: Monitoring engineers need to identify and diagnose system issues quickly and efficiently. Strong analytical skills are essential for interpreting data, identifying patterns, and resolving complex problems.
  • Communication Skills: Effective communication is crucial for collaborating with other engineers, reporting issues, and explaining technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
  • Teamwork: Monitoring engineers often work as part of a team to ensure system stability and performance. Collaboration and the ability to contribute to a shared goal are essential.

These qualifications provide a strong foundation for a successful career as a Graduate Trainee - Associate Monitoring Engineer at PayU.
job_description:
Graduate Trainee - Associate Monitoring Engineer at PayU

About PayU

PayU is a leading global payments technology company, providing innovative and secure payment solutions to businesses of all sizes. With a strong presence in emerging markets, PayU empowers businesses to grow and thrive in the digital economy.

Job Description

PayU is seeking highly motivated and talented individuals for its Graduate Trainee - Associate Monitoring Engineer program. This program offers a unique opportunity for recent graduates to gain valuable experience in a dynamic and fast-paced environment, while contributing to the success of a leading payments technology company.

Responsibilities

  • Monitor and analyze system performance, identifying potential issues and implementing solutions to ensure optimal uptime and stability.
  • Develop and maintain monitoring dashboards and reports, providing actionable insights to stakeholders.
  • Collaborate with engineering teams to troubleshoot and resolve technical issues, contributing to the continuous improvement of system reliability.
  • Stay abreast of industry best practices and emerging technologies in the field of system monitoring and performance optimization.
  • Participate in on-call rotations, providing 24/7 support for critical systems.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor's or Master's degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related quantitative discipline from a top-tier institution.
  • Candidates should be in their pre-final or final year of undergraduate or postgraduate studies (5th or 6th semester for undergraduates, 2nd or 3rd semester for postgraduates).
  • Proficiency in Python and SQL.
  • Strong analytical abilities, logical reasoning, and a structured approach to problem-solving.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively present data-driven insights to senior management.
  • A high level of accountability, adaptability, and the ability to manage multiple responsibilities simultaneously.
  • Demonstrated ability to execute detailed analyses and tackle complex challenges.
  • A proactive, energetic attitude with a determination to achieve results and contribute positively to the team.

Location

Mumbai, Bangalore, or Gurgaon (Hybrid work model)

Internship Duration

6 to 12 months
key_responsibility:
Key Responsibilities: Graduate Trainee - Associate Monitoring Engineer (PayU)

This role provides a comprehensive learning experience for recent graduates in quantitative fields, focusing on developing monitoring and analytical skills within PayU's dynamic environment.

1. System Monitoring and Alerting:

  • Proactively monitor PayU's critical systems and applications for performance, availability, and security issues.
  • Analyze system logs and metrics to identify anomalies and potential problems.
  • Configure and manage monitoring alerts to ensure timely notification of critical events.
  • Collaborate with engineering teams to investigate and resolve system issues.
  • Document monitoring procedures and processes for knowledge sharing and future reference.

2. Data Analysis and Reporting:

  • Collect and analyze data from various sources to identify trends, patterns, and potential risks.
  • Develop and maintain dashboards to visualize key performance indicators (KPIs) and system health.
  • Generate regular reports on system performance, security incidents, and other relevant metrics.
  • Present data-driven insights to senior management, highlighting areas for improvement and potential risks.
  • Utilize SQL and Python to query, manipulate, and analyze large datasets.

3. Process Improvement and Automation:

  • Identify opportunities to automate monitoring tasks and improve operational efficiency.
  • Develop and implement scripts to automate data collection, analysis, and reporting.
  • Contribute to the development and maintenance of monitoring tools and infrastructure.
  • Stay abreast of industry best practices for system monitoring and data analysis.
  • Proactively suggest and implement process improvements to enhance monitoring effectiveness.

This role offers a challenging and rewarding opportunity for recent graduates to gain valuable experience in system monitoring, data analysis, and process improvement within a fast-paced and innovative environment.
