job_description:
Software Engineer – Intern at Zeotap

About Zeotap

Zeotap is a leading provider of customer data platforms (CDPs) that empower businesses to leverage the power of data for personalized customer experiences.

Job Description

Zeotap is seeking a highly motivated and talented Software Engineer Intern to join our dynamic product development team. This internship offers a unique opportunity to gain hands-on experience in building and maintaining data-driven applications at scale. The intern will work closely with senior engineers, contributing to all phases of the software development lifecycle.

Responsibilities

  • Participate in agile development sprints, contributing to the design, development, and testing of new features and modules for Zeotap's data platform.
  • Write clean, efficient, and well-documented code in accordance with industry best practices and coding standards.
  • Assist in debugging and resolving production issues, collaborating with senior engineers to identify root causes and implement effective solutions.
  • Research and evaluate emerging technologies relevant to Zeotap's business needs, proposing and implementing innovative solutions.
  • Adhere to Zeotap's strict privacy and information security policies and procedures, ensuring the confidentiality and integrity of customer data.
  • Complete all assigned awareness training on time, staying up-to-date on relevant industry regulations and best practices.

Requirements

  • Minimum commitment of 6 months for the internship.
  • Strong academic performance in a Computer Science or IT program.
  • Proficiency in advanced data structures and algorithms.
  • Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
  • Strong programming skills in one of the following languages: Java, Scala, GoLang, or Python.
  • Above basic level SQL querying skills, including experience with complex queries and data manipulation.
  • Familiarity with Big Data technologies and NoSQL databases is a plus.
  • Experience handling large datasets (terabyte scale) is highly desirable.
  • Understanding of transactional and high-scale system design principles.

This internship offers a valuable opportunity to learn from experienced engineers, contribute to cutting-edge technology, and gain practical experience in the dynamic field of data-driven applications.

selection_process:
Zeotap Software Engineer – Intern Hiring Workflow

This multi-stage process aims to identify candidates with the technical skills, problem-solving abilities, and cultural fit required for a successful internship at Zeotap.

  • Evaluation criteria: Technical knowledge, communication skills, problem-solving abilities, and cultural fit.

qualification:
Software Engineer, I - Zebra: Typical Qualifications & Requirements

This section outlines the typical qualifications and requirements for a Software Engineer, I position at Zebra, a global technology company specializing in barcode and RFID solutions.

I. Education & Experience

  • Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field: A strong foundation in computer science principles is essential for understanding software development methodologies, data structures, and algorithms.
  • 0-2 years of professional software development experience: While entry-level, some practical experience is beneficial for applying theoretical knowledge to real-world projects. This could include internships, personal projects, or contributions to open-source software.

II. Technical Skills

  • Proficiency in at least one object-oriented programming language (e.g., Java, C++, Python): Object-oriented programming is a fundamental paradigm in software development, enabling the creation of modular, reusable, and maintainable code.
  • Understanding of software development lifecycle (SDLC) methodologies (e.g., Agile, Waterfall): Familiarity with different SDLC methodologies ensures efficient collaboration, project management, and software delivery.
  • Basic knowledge of databases (e.g., SQL, NoSQL): Software engineers often interact with databases to store, retrieve, and manage data. Understanding database concepts and querying languages is crucial.
  • Version control systems (e.g., Git): Version control systems are essential for tracking code changes, collaborating with other developers, and managing software releases.

III. Soft Skills

  • Strong problem-solving and analytical skills: Software engineers constantly encounter challenges and need to analyze problems, identify solutions, and implement them effectively.
  • Excellent communication and teamwork skills: Collaboration is key in software development. Clear communication with team members, stakeholders, and clients is essential for successful project execution.
  • Adaptability and willingness to learn: The technology landscape is constantly evolving. Software engineers must be adaptable and eager to learn new technologies and programming languages.

These qualifications provide a comprehensive framework for evaluating candidates for the Software Engineer, I position at Zebra.

selection_process:
Eurofins Scientific - Associate Software Engineer Hiring Workflow

This multi-stage process aims to identify the best-fit candidate for the Associate Software Engineer role at Eurofins Scientific.

1. Application Screening (3-5 business days)

  • What happens: HR reviews submitted resumes and applications against pre-defined criteria, focusing on technical skills, education, and relevant experience.
  • Who's involved: HR team
  • Duration: 3-5 business days
  • Evaluation criteria: Technical skills (programming languages, frameworks), education (computer science degree preferred), relevant experience, soft skills (communication, teamwork).
  • Candidate expectations: Submit a complete and accurate application highlighting relevant skills and experience.

2. Technical Phone Screening (1-2 business days)

  • What happens: A technical recruiter conducts a phone interview to assess the candidate's technical knowledge and problem-solving abilities.
  • Who's involved: Technical recruiter
  • Duration: 30-45 minutes
  • Evaluation criteria: Understanding of core programming concepts, ability to articulate technical solutions, problem-solving skills.
  • Candidate expectations: Be prepared to discuss technical projects, demonstrate coding knowledge, and answer questions about software development methodologies.

3. Coding Assessment (1 week)

  • What happens: Candidates complete a coding challenge designed to evaluate their practical skills and ability to write clean, efficient code.
  • Who's involved: Hiring manager, technical team
  • Duration: 1 week (candidates have a set timeframe to complete the assessment)
  • Evaluation criteria: Code quality, problem-solving approach, adherence to best practices, time management.
  • Candidate expectations: Demonstrate proficiency in the required programming languages and frameworks, write well-structured and documented code.

4. On-site Interview (1-2 days)

  • What happens: Candidates participate in a series of interviews with the hiring manager, technical team members, and potentially other stakeholders.
  • Who's involved: Hiring manager, technical team, potential stakeholders
  • Duration: 1-2 days (including travel time if applicable)
  • Evaluation criteria: Technical expertise, problem-solving skills, communication skills, cultural fit, teamwork abilities.
  • Candidate expectations: Prepare for technical discussions, behavioral questions, and presentations.

5. Decision and Offer (1-2 weeks)

  • What happens: The hiring team reviews all candidate feedback and makes a final decision. A job offer is extended to the selected candidate.
  • Who's involved: Hiring manager, HR team
  • Duration: 1-2 weeks
  • Evaluation criteria: Overall fit with the role, team, and company culture.
  • Candidate expectations: Receive a formal job offer outlining compensation, benefits, and start date.

This comprehensive process ensures Eurofins Scientific selects the most qualified and suitable Associate Software Engineer for their team.

Culture and Values:

selection_process:
Cognizant Graduate Trainee Hiring Workflow

This multi-stage hiring process aims to identify candidates with the technical aptitude, problem-solving skills, and collaborative spirit essential for success as a Graduate Trainee at Cognizant.

1. Application Screening (Duration: 1 week)

  • What happens: Applications are reviewed against eligibility criteria (academic performance, degree, nationality, etc.). Resumes are assessed for relevant skills, projects, and experience.
  • Who's involved: HR team, Hiring Manager
  • Evaluation criteria: Academic record, resume content, alignment with job description
  • Candidate expectations: Submit a complete and accurate application, highlighting relevant skills and experiences.

2. Online Assessment (Duration: 2 days)

  • What happens: Candidates complete a series of online tests evaluating technical skills (coding, problem-solving), logical reasoning, and communication abilities.
  • Who's involved: Candidates, automated assessment platform
  • Evaluation criteria: Test scores, accuracy, time management
  • Candidate expectations: Prepare for technical assessments, practice coding and problem-solving skills.

3. Technical Interview (Duration: 1 week)

  • What happens: Shortlisted candidates participate in a technical interview with a senior developer or engineer. The interview focuses on understanding their technical knowledge, problem-solving approach, and coding abilities.
  • Who's involved: Candidate, Senior Developer/Engineer
  • Evaluation criteria: Technical knowledge, problem-solving skills, coding proficiency, communication
  • Candidate expectations: Prepare for technical questions related to programming languages, data structures, algorithms, and software development methodologies.

4. Behavioral Interview (Duration: 1 week)

  • What happens: Candidates participate in a behavioral interview with an HR representative or Hiring Manager. This interview assesses their soft skills, teamwork abilities, communication style, and cultural fit within Cognizant.
  • Who's involved: Candidate, HR Representative/Hiring Manager
  • Evaluation criteria: Communication skills, teamwork, problem-solving, adaptability, cultural fit
  • Candidate expectations: Prepare for behavioral questions focusing on past experiences, challenges, and how they demonstrate key competencies.

5. Final Decision & Offer (Duration: 1 week)

  • What happens: The hiring team reviews all interview feedback and makes a final decision. Successful candidates receive a formal job offer outlining compensation, benefits, and start date.
  • Who's involved: Hiring Manager, HR team
  • Evaluation criteria: Overall performance in all stages, alignment with company values and culture
  • Candidate expectations: Respond to the job offer promptly and complete any necessary onboarding paperwork.

Kyndryl Customer Service Representative: Qualifications & Requirements

This section outlines the typical qualifications and requirements for a Customer Service Representative position at Kyndryl.

I. Education & Experience

  • High School Diploma or Equivalent: A high school diploma or equivalent is the minimum educational requirement for this role. It demonstrates a foundational understanding of communication, problem-solving, and basic computer literacy, essential for interacting with customers and navigating internal systems.
  • 1+ Years of Customer Service Experience: Prior experience in a customer-facing role is highly valued. This could include retail, call center, or technical support positions. Experience handling customer inquiries, resolving issues, and maintaining positive relationships is crucial for success.

II. Required Skills

  • Excellent Communication Skills (Verbal & Written): Clear and concise communication is paramount. Representatives must articulate information accurately, actively listen to customer concerns, and tailor their responses accordingly. Proficiency in written communication is also essential for email correspondence and documentation.
  • Problem-Solving & Critical Thinking: Customer service often involves identifying the root cause of issues and finding effective solutions. Strong analytical skills and the ability to think critically are necessary to navigate complex situations and provide satisfactory resolutions.
  • Technical Proficiency: While specific technical knowledge may vary depending on the service area, a basic understanding of computer systems, software applications, and troubleshooting techniques is beneficial. Familiarity with CRM systems and other relevant tools is a plus.
  • Empathy & Patience: Dealing with frustrated or upset customers requires empathy and patience. Representatives must remain calm, understanding, and professional while striving to de-escalate situations and build rapport.

III. Additional Requirements

  • Availability to work flexible hours: Customer service often involves shift work, including evenings and weekends.
  • Strong work ethic and commitment to providing excellent customer service: Kyndryl values customer satisfaction and expects representatives to be dedicated to delivering exceptional service.

These qualifications provide a framework for understanding the typical requirements for a Customer Service Representative at Kyndryl.
job_description:
Customer Service Representative - Kyndryl

About Kyndryl

Kyndryl is the world's largest IT infrastructure services provider, helping clients modernize and optimize their mission-critical systems. With a global presence and a deep understanding of technology, Kyndryl delivers innovative solutions that empower businesses to thrive in a rapidly changing world.

Job Summary

Kyndryl is seeking a Customer Service Representative to join our dynamic team. In this role, you will be responsible for providing exceptional technical support to our valued clients via phone and chat. You will troubleshoot technical issues, answer inquiries, and guide customers through solutions, ensuring a positive and efficient experience.

Responsibilities

  • Provide timely and effective technical support to clients experiencing issues with Windows 10 operating systems.
  • Diagnose and resolve technical problems, utilizing troubleshooting skills and knowledge of Windows 10 functionalities.
  • Communicate clearly and professionally with clients, understanding their needs and providing tailored solutions.
  • Document customer interactions and technical resolutions accurately.
  • Adhere to established service level agreements and quality standards.
  • Collaborate with team members to share knowledge and ensure consistent support delivery.

Required Skills and Experience

  • Up to 1 year of experience in a customer support or technical assistance role.
  • Proficiency in Windows 10 troubleshooting.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, both written and verbal.
  • Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment.
  • Willingness to work night shifts and rotational schedules.
  • Comfort working from the office under a hybrid work setup.

Preferred Skills and Experience

  • Strong analytical and troubleshooting capabilities.
  • Familiarity with Windows, macOS, or Linux environments.
  • Background in help desk or technical support roles.
  • Prior experience in customer-facing support positions.
  • Ability to adjust communication style based on customer preferences and requirements.
key_responsibility:
Kyndryl - Customer Service Representative: Key Responsibilities

This role focuses on providing technical support and customer service to Kyndryl clients via phone and chat.

I. Technical Support

  • Troubleshooting Windows 10 Issues:
    • Diagnose and resolve technical issues reported by customers experiencing problems with their Windows 10 operating systems.
    • This includes addressing software conflicts, hardware malfunctions, network connectivity problems, and other common Windows 10 issues.
    • Utilize diagnostic tools and resources to identify the root cause of the problem and implement effective solutions.
    • Expected Outcome: Successfully resolve customer issues, minimizing downtime and ensuring customer satisfaction.
  • Providing Technical Guidance:
    • Offer clear and concise instructions to customers on how to perform basic troubleshooting steps.
    • Explain technical concepts in a user-friendly manner, ensuring customers understand the solutions provided.
    • Escalate complex issues to senior technicians when necessary.
    • Expected Outcome: Empower customers to resolve minor issues independently and guide them through more complex problems.

II. Customer Service

  • Handling Customer Interactions:
    • Respond to customer inquiries promptly and professionally via phone and chat platforms.
    • Actively listen to customer concerns, empathize with their situation, and provide personalized solutions.
    • Maintain a positive and helpful attitude throughout all interactions.
    • Expected Outcome: Deliver exceptional customer service, building rapport and fostering positive customer relationships.
  • Documenting Customer Interactions:
    • Accurately record all customer interactions, including the nature of the issue, steps taken to resolve it, and the final outcome.
    • Utilize CRM software to manage customer information and track support requests.
    • Expected Outcome: Maintain a comprehensive record of customer interactions, enabling efficient issue tracking and resolution.

III. Teamwork and Continuous Improvement

  • Collaborating with Team Members:
    • Work effectively as part of a team to ensure seamless customer support.
    • Share knowledge and best practices with colleagues to enhance team performance.
    • Expected Outcome: Contribute to a positive and collaborative team environment, fostering knowledge sharing and continuous improvement.
  • Staying Updated on Technology:
    • Keep abreast of the latest Windows 10 updates, security patches, and troubleshooting techniques.
    • Participate in training programs to enhance technical skills and knowledge.
    • Expected Outcome: Maintain a high level of technical expertise and provide accurate and up-to-date support to customers.

Kyndryl Customer Service Representative Hiring Workflow

This multi-stage process aims to identify candidates with the necessary skills, experience, and personality traits to excel as Customer Service Representatives at Kyndryl.

Software Engineer – QA Automation (Entry Level) at Cisco: Typical Qualifications

This section outlines the typical qualifications and requirements for an entry-level Software Engineer – QA Automation position at Cisco.

Education:

  • Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field: A strong foundation in computer science principles is essential for understanding software development processes and designing effective test automation solutions.

  • Relevant coursework in software testing, quality assurance, or automation: Courses covering software testing methodologies, automation frameworks, and scripting languages are highly beneficial.

Technical Skills:

  • Proficiency in at least one programming language (e.g., Python, Java, C#): This skill is crucial for writing automated test scripts, interacting with APIs, and manipulating data. Entry-level candidates should demonstrate a solid understanding of programming fundamentals and the ability to write clean, maintainable code.

  • Experience with automation testing frameworks (e.g., Selenium, Appium, Cypress): Familiarity with popular testing frameworks allows engineers to efficiently automate web and mobile application testing.

  • Basic understanding of software development lifecycle (SDLC) methodologies (e.g., Agile, Waterfall): Knowledge of SDLC principles ensures the QA engineer can integrate seamlessly into development teams and contribute to the overall software development process.

  • Familiarity with version control systems (e.g., Git): Version control is essential for collaborative development and tracking code changes.

Soft Skills:

  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills: QA engineers need to identify potential issues, analyze test results, and troubleshoot problems effectively.

  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills: Working closely with developers, product managers, and other stakeholders requires clear and concise communication.

  • Attention to detail and a commitment to quality: Thoroughness and a focus on delivering high-quality software are paramount in QA.

These qualifications provide a strong foundation for an entry-level Software Engineer – QA Automation at Cisco.
job_description:
Software Engineer – QA Automation (Entry Level) at Cisco

About the Cisco Apprenticeship Program

The Cisco Apprenticeship Program offers a unique opportunity for recent graduates to gain valuable hands-on experience in a corporate setting while developing essential industry skills. This program provides a structured learning environment with mentorship and real-world projects, allowing apprentices to build a strong foundation for a successful career in technology.

Job Description

This entry-level Software Engineer – QA Automation position within the Cisco Apprenticeship Program focuses on developing and executing automated test scripts to ensure the quality and functionality of Cisco's software products. Apprentices will work closely with experienced engineers, learning industry best practices and contributing to the development of robust testing strategies.

Responsibilities:

  • Design, develop, and execute automated test scripts using industry-standard tools and frameworks.
  • Identify and document software defects, providing clear and concise bug reports.
  • Collaborate with development teams to understand software requirements and design effective test cases.
  • Participate in code reviews and provide feedback on testability and maintainability.
  • Contribute to the development and maintenance of test automation infrastructure.
  • Stay up-to-date with the latest testing methodologies and technologies.
  • Analyze test results and provide insights to improve software quality.

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in a non-engineering field (e.g., Computer Science, Information Technology, Mathematics) completed in 2024.
  • Provisional Degree Certificate required.
  • Availability for a 12-month apprenticeship starting in August 2025.
  • Basic proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to work effectively in a team environment.
  • Passion for learning and a willingness to take on new challenges.
  • Registered as a “student” at NATSand possess a valid enrollment number.

Benefits:

  • Gain hands-on experience in a leading technology company.
  • Develop valuable skills in software testing and automation.
  • Receive mentorship and guidance from experienced engineers.
  • Build a strong network within the industry.
  • Earn a competitive salary and benefits package.
key_responsibility:
Software Engineer – QA Automation (Entry Level) - Key Responsibilities

This section outlines the key responsibilities expected of a Software Engineer – QA Automation (Entry Level) within the Cisco Apprenticeship Program.

Software Testing & Quality Assurance:

  • Develop and execute test cases: Design comprehensive test cases covering various functionalities and scenarios of software applications. This includes creating test plans, identifying test data, and documenting test results.
  • Automate test scripts: Utilize scripting languages (e.g., Python, Java) and automation frameworks (e.g., Selenium, Appium) to automate repetitive test cases, improving efficiency and coverage.
  • Identify and report bugs: Meticulously analyze test results and effectively communicate identified defects to the development team through detailed bug reports, including steps to reproduce the issue and expected outcomes.
  • Collaborate with developers: Work closely with software developers to understand requirements, clarify ambiguities, and ensure that code meets quality standards. Participate in code reviews to identify potential issues early in the development cycle.
  • Contribute to continuous improvement: Actively participate in discussions and initiatives aimed at improving the software testing process, proposing innovative solutions and best practices.

Technical Skills & Learning:

  • Learn and apply testing methodologies: Gain proficiency in various software testing methodologies, including black-box, white-box, and grey-box testing. Understand the principles of test-driven development (TDD) and behavior-driven development (BDD).
  • Master automation tools and frameworks: Develop expertise in using industry-standard automation tools and frameworks, staying updated on the latest technologies and trends in the field.
  • Expand knowledge of software development lifecycle: Gain a deeper understanding of the software development lifecycle (SDLC) and how QA automation fits within the overall process.
  • Embrace continuous learning: Actively seek opportunities to expand technical knowledge and skills through online courses, workshops, and industry events.

Communication & Teamwork:

  • Communicate effectively: Clearly and concisely communicate test results, bug reports, and technical information to both technical and non-technical audiences.
  • Collaborate effectively: Work collaboratively with team members, developers, and stakeholders to achieve shared goals.
  • Contribute to a positive team environment: Demonstrate a positive attitude, willingness to help others, and commitment to team success.

This comprehensive list of responsibilities provides a clear understanding of the expectations for a Software Engineer – QA Automation (Entry Level) within the Cisco Apprenticeship Program.

qualification:
Jio Graduate Engineer Trainee: Qualifications & Requirements

This section outlines the typical qualifications and requirements for a Graduate Engineer Trainee position at Jio, a leading telecommunications company in India.

Education:

  • Bachelor's Degree in Engineering: A strong foundation in engineering principles is essential. Jio seeks candidates with a Bachelor's degree in a relevant field such as Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Telecommunications Engineering, or a closely related discipline.
    • Importance: A formal engineering education provides the theoretical knowledge and practical skills necessary to understand complex technical systems and contribute to innovative solutions within Jio's diverse engineering teams.
    • Proficiency: A minimum of a Bachelor's degree is expected, with a strong academic record demonstrating a solid understanding of core engineering concepts.

Technical Skills:

  • Programming Languages: Proficiency in at least one programming language like Python, Java, C++, or JavaScript is highly desirable.
    • Importance: Jio heavily relies on software development and automation. Programming skills are crucial for developing and maintaining applications, network infrastructure, and data analysis tools.
    • Proficiency: Candidates should demonstrate practical experience and proficiency in at least one language, with the ability to learn and adapt to new technologies quickly.

  • Data Structures and Algorithms: A fundamental understanding of data structures and algorithms is essential for efficient problem-solving and software development.

    • Importance: Jio handles massive amounts of data. Knowledge of data structures and algorithms allows engineers to design and implement efficient solutions for data processing, storage, and retrieval.
    • Proficiency: A solid grasp of common data structures (arrays, linked lists, trees, graphs) and algorithms (sorting, searching, graph traversal) is expected.

  • Networking Fundamentals: Basic understanding of networking concepts (TCP/IP, OSI model, routing protocols) is beneficial.

    • Importance: Jio operates a vast telecommunications network. Familiarity with networking fundamentals is crucial for understanding network infrastructure, troubleshooting issues, and contributing to network optimization.
    • Proficiency: A foundational understanding of networking concepts is expected, with the ability to learn and apply more specialized knowledge as needed.

Soft Skills:

  • Problem-Solving: The ability to analyze problems, identify root causes, and develop effective solutions is essential.
    • Importance: Jio engineers face complex technical challenges daily. Strong problem-solving skills are crucial for identifying solutions, implementing them, and ensuring their effectiveness.
  • Communication: Excellent written and verbal communication skills are necessary for collaborating with team members, stakeholders, and clients.
    • Importance: Jio operates in a highly collaborative environment. Clear and concise communication is essential for sharing ideas, explaining technical concepts, and working effectively as part of a team.
  • Teamwork: The ability to work effectively in a team environment is crucial for achieving shared goals.
    • Importance: Jio projects often involve cross-functional teams. Strong teamwork skills are essential for collaborating with engineers, designers, product managers, and other stakeholders to deliver successful outcomes.

These qualifications provide a framework for aspiring Graduate Engineer Trainees at Jio. Candidates who demonstrate a strong combination of technical expertise, problem-solving abilities, and soft skills are well-positioned to succeed in this challenging and rewarding role.
job_description:
Graduate Engineer Trainee - International Network Solutions

Company: Jio

Location: [City, State]

About the Role:

Jio is seeking highly motivated and talented Graduate Engineer Trainees to join our dynamic team. This is an exciting opportunity for recent graduates to gain hands-on experience in the design, development, and implementation of international network solutions.

Responsibilities:

  • Network Design and Development: Contribute to the design and development of comprehensive international network solutions, ensuring seamless connectivity and optimal performance across global regions.
  • Roaming Service Enablement: Collaborate with product and hardware teams to define technical requirements for enabling 2G, 3G, and 4G roaming services, ensuring interoperability and adherence to industry standards.
  • Technical Specification Review: Review and validate technical specifications and designs to ensure they support global roaming functionalities, including authentication, authorization, accounting, billing, provisioning, and performance tracking.
  • Proposal Development: Assist in preparing technical proposals for new network installations, upgrades, or investments, incorporating input from business teams to support internal decision-making and budgeting processes.
  • Service Provider Assessment: Conduct assessments of service providers to evaluate their network performance, coverage capabilities, and adherence to service level agreements (SLAs).
  • Troubleshooting and Root Cause Analysis: Investigate and resolve network routing issues and performance bottlenecks, utilizing analytical and problem-solving skills to identify root causes and implement effective solutions.
  • System Enhancement Recommendations: Perform root cause analysis and provide actionable recommendations for system enhancements, contributing to the continuous improvement of network reliability and efficiency.

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor of Engineering (B.E.) or Bachelor of Technology (B.Tech.) in Computer Science, Telecommunications, Electrical Engineering, or a related discipline.
  • Open to fresh graduates with a strong academic record and a passion for network engineering.

Required Skills and Competencies:

  • Fundamental understanding of 2G, 3G, and 4G wireless technologies and protocols.
  • Familiarity with network setup, implementation, and configuration processes.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to effectively convey technical information to both technical and non-technical audiences.
  • Strong analytical thinking and problem-solving abilities, with a demonstrated aptitude for identifying and resolving complex technical issues.
  • Ability to work effectively both independently and as part of a collaborative team environment.
  • Awareness of business operations and strategic thinking, with the ability to understand the impact of technical decisions on overall business objectives.
key_responsibility:
Graduate Engineer Trainee - Jio

Network Design and Development

  • Develop and design comprehensive international network solutions: This involves creating technical blueprints and architectures for global network infrastructure, ensuring seamless connectivity and data flow across borders.
    • Expected Outcome: Functional and scalable network solutions that meet Jio's international expansion goals.
  • Collaborate with product and hardware teams to outline requirements for enabling 2G, 3G, and 4G roaming services: Work closely with cross-functional teams to define technical specifications and functionalities required for seamless roaming experiences for Jio customers.
    • Expected Outcome: Clear and comprehensive requirements documentation for implementing roaming services across different network technologies.
  • Review and ensure technical specifications and designs support global roaming, including functions like authentication, authorization, accounting, billing, provisioning, and performance tracking: Scrutinize technical documentation to ensure adherence to global roaming standards and best practices, covering all aspects of user authentication, service access, billing, and performance monitoring.
    • Expected Outcome: Network designs and specifications that comply with global roaming standards, enabling secure and efficient roaming services.

Network Performance and Optimization

  • Assist in preparing technical proposals for new network installations, upgrades, or investments, incorporating input from business teams for internal decision-making and budgeting: Contribute technical expertise to proposals for network expansion or modernization, justifying technical choices and cost implications to support informed business decisions.
    • Expected Outcome: Well-structured technical proposals that effectively communicate the need for network investments and their potential benefits.
  • Conduct assessments of service providers to evaluate their network performance and coverage capabilities: Analyze network performance data and coverage maps of potential service providers to ensure they meet Jio's quality standards and coverage requirements.
    • Expected Outcome: Objective assessments of service providers, enabling informed decisions regarding partnerships and network expansion.
  • Investigate and resolve issues related to network routing and overall system performance: Troubleshoot network connectivity issues, analyze routing protocols, and identify bottlenecks to ensure optimal network performance and data flow.
    • Expected Outcome: Swift resolution of network issues, minimizing service disruptions and ensuring reliable network connectivity.
  • Perform root cause analysis and provide actionable recommendations for system enhancements: Identify the underlying causes of network problems and propose solutions to prevent recurrence, contributing to continuous network improvement.
    • Expected Outcome: Proactive identification and resolution of network issues, leading to a more robust and reliable network infrastructure.
about_company:
About Jio

Jio is a leading telecommunications company in India, revolutionizing the digital landscape with its innovative products and services. As a subsidiary of Reliance Industries Limited, Jio leverages its parent company's vast resources and expertise to deliver cutting-edge technology solutions to millions of customers across the country.

Mission and Vision:

Jio's mission is to empower every Indian with affordable and accessible digital connectivity, bridging the digital divide and fostering inclusive growth. The company envisions a future where technology seamlessly integrates into every aspect of life, driving progress and innovation.

Culture and Values:

Market Position and Growth Trajectory:

The company continues to invest heavily in expanding its network infrastructure and developing new technologies, solidifying its position as a leader in the industry.

Jio's commitment to digital inclusion and technological advancement positions it at the forefront of India's digital transformation, shaping the future of connectivity for generations to come.
selection_process:
Jio Graduate Engineer Trainee Selection Process

This multi-stage process aims to identify candidates with the technical aptitude, communication skills, and problem-solving abilities necessary to succeed as a Graduate Engineer Trainee at Jio.

1. Application Screening (1 week)

  • What happens: Jio reviews submitted applications, focusing on educational qualifications, relevant projects, and skills mentioned.
  • Who's involved: HR team and hiring manager.
  • Duration: 1 week.
  • Evaluation criteria: Alignment with minimum requirements, demonstrable technical interest, and strong communication skills.
  • Candidate expectations: Submit a complete and accurate application highlighting relevant experience and skills.

2. Online Assessment (2 weeks)

  • What happens: Shortlisted candidates complete an online assessment covering technical concepts related to 2G, 3G, and 4G technologies, network fundamentals, and problem-solving scenarios.
  • Who's involved: Candidates and an automated assessment platform.
  • Duration: 2 weeks (candidates have a set timeframe to complete the assessment).
  • Evaluation criteria: Accuracy, speed, and understanding of technical concepts.
  • Candidate expectations: Prepare for technical questions and practice problem-solving under time constraints.

3. Technical Interview (1 week)

  • What happens: Top-performing candidates participate in a technical interview with a senior engineer, focusing on their understanding of network technologies, design principles, and problem-solving approach.
  • Who's involved: Candidates and a senior engineer from the relevant department.
  • Duration: 1 week (multiple rounds of interviews may be conducted).
  • Evaluation criteria: Technical knowledge, analytical thinking, communication skills, and ability to apply concepts to real-world scenarios.
  • Candidate expectations: Prepare to discuss technical concepts in detail, demonstrate problem-solving skills, and articulate their understanding of network solutions.

4. Behavioral Interview (1 week)

  • What happens: Candidates participate in a behavioral interview with an HR representative or hiring manager, assessing their soft skills, teamwork abilities, and cultural fit within Jio.
  • Who's involved: Candidates and an HR representative or hiring manager.
  • Duration: 1 week.
  • Evaluation criteria: Communication skills, teamwork, adaptability, problem-solving approach, and alignment with company values.
  • Candidate expectations: Prepare to discuss past experiences, highlight relevant skills, and demonstrate their enthusiasm for working at Jio.

5. Offer and Onboarding (2 weeks)

  • What happens: Selected candidates receive a formal job offer outlining compensation, benefits, and start date. Successful candidates undergo onboarding procedures, including paperwork, training, and introductions to the team.
  • Who's involved: HR team, hiring manager, and new employee.
  • Duration: 2 weeks.
  • Evaluation criteria: Candidate acceptance of the offer and successful completion of onboarding procedures.
  • Candidate expectations: Review the offer carefully, negotiate if necessary, and actively participate in onboarding activities.

job_description:
Graduate Trainee at Calix

About Calix

Calix is a leading provider of cloud-native software and services for communications service providers (CSPs). The company empowers CSPs to deliver next-generation broadband services, including fiber, 5G, and Wi-Fi, to residential and business customers. Calix is headquartered in San Jose, California, with a global presence.

Job Description

Calix is seeking highly motivated and talented graduates to join its Graduate Trainee program. This program provides a comprehensive and structured onboarding experience designed to equip graduates with the skills and knowledge necessary to succeed in a dynamic and innovative technology environment.

Responsibilities

  • Gain hands-on experience in various departments across Calix, including engineering, product management, marketing, and sales.
  • Participate in cross-functional projects, collaborating with experienced professionals to deliver impactful results.
  • Develop a deep understanding of Calix's products, services, and industry landscape.
  • Attend training sessions and workshops to enhance technical and soft skills.
  • Contribute to the development of innovative solutions and contribute to the company's growth.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree in a relevant field such as computer science, engineering, business administration, or marketing.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Ability to work effectively in a team environment.
  • Passion for technology and a desire to learn and grow.

Benefits

Calix offers a competitive compensation package and a comprehensive benefits program, including medical, dental, vision, and 401(k). The company also provides opportunities for professional development and career advancement.

job_description:
Associate Trainee - Graduate Trainee Program at DHL IT Services

About DHL IT Services

DHL IT Services is a global leader in providing IT solutions for the logistics industry. As a part of the Deutsche Post DHL Group, we leverage cutting-edge technology to optimize supply chain operations, enhance customer experience, and drive innovation.

Job Overview

DHL IT Services is seeking highly motivated and technically proficient graduates to join our prestigious Graduate Trainee Program. This program offers a comprehensive learning experience designed to equip participants with the skills and knowledge necessary to thrive in the dynamic IT landscape.

Responsibilities

As an Associate Trainee, you will:

  • Receive intensive training: Gain in-depth knowledge of cutting-edge technologies relevant to the logistics industry.
  • Collaborate on innovative projects: Work alongside experienced professionals in cross-functional teams to contribute to the development of innovative IT solutions.
  • Apply data-driven insights: Utilize data design, modeling, and analysis techniques to optimize data structures and support business decision-making.
  • Develop technical skills: Write and maintain simple scripts and programs using industry-standard tools and practices.
  • Troubleshoot and resolve issues: Identify and resolve application issues to enhance functionality and improve operational efficiency.
  • Gain business acumen: Develop a comprehensive understanding of DHL's core business products, services, and operations.

Qualifications

  • Academic Background: Final-year students graduating in 2025 with no prior professional experience, holding a B.Tech / B.E / MCA in Computer Science, Information Technology, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, or Data Science (or related fields).
  • Academic Requirements: Minimum CGPA of 7.0 or above with no active backlogs. Clearly mention your degree specialization in your resume.
  • Desired Skills: Strong foundational knowledge of modern technologies, basic understanding of IT systems and services, analytical and problem-solving capabilities, willingness to learn and adapt, effective communication and teamwork skills. Familiarity with software engineering practices and development methodologies is advantageous.

Program Details

  • Location: Indore, Madhya Pradesh
  • Tenure Commitment: Minimum 18 months at the Indore office (relocation during this period is not permitted).
  • Interview Travel: Shortlisted candidates will be responsible for managing their own travel to Indore for interviews.
  • Application Deadline: 12 June 2025
key_responsibility:
Associate Trainee - DHL IT Services: Key Responsibilities

This role focuses on providing foundational IT experience within DHL's dynamic environment.

Technical Skill Development & Application:

  • Technology Training: Actively participate in comprehensive training programs designed to equip you with expertise in cutting-edge IT technologies relevant to DHL's operations.
  • Data Management: Apply data design, modeling, and analysis techniques to support and enhance data structures within DHL's IT systems. This includes understanding data relationships, identifying patterns, and contributing to data quality improvements.
  • Scripting & Programming: Develop and maintain simple scripts and programs using industry-standard tools and programming languages. This involves translating business requirements into functional code, adhering to best practices, and ensuring code readability and maintainability.
  • Application Support: Identify and resolve application issues to improve functionality and efficiency. This includes troubleshooting technical problems, analyzing error logs, and collaborating with developers to implement solutions.

Teamwork & Collaboration:

  • Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work effectively within cross-functional teams comprising individuals from diverse IT disciplines and business units. This involves actively contributing to team discussions, sharing knowledge, and collaborating on project deliverables.
  • Communication & Reporting: Communicate technical information clearly and concisely to both technical and non-technical audiences. This includes preparing reports, documenting processes, and providing updates on project progress.

Business Understanding & Value Creation:

  • Business Process Insight: Gain a comprehensive understanding of DHL's core business products, services, and operational processes. This involves learning about the company's value chain, customer interactions, and key performance indicators.
  • Value-Driven Problem Solving: Apply technical skills and business knowledge to identify and solve problems that contribute to DHL's overall efficiency and effectiveness. This involves analyzing business challenges, proposing innovative solutions, and measuring the impact of implemented changes.

job_description:
Intern at Harman

About Harman

Harman International Industries, Incorporated is a global leader in connected technologies for automotive, consumer, and enterprise markets. Driven by a passion for innovation, Harman develops and delivers audio, visual, and connected solutions that enrich people's lives.

Job Description

Harman is seeking a highly motivated and talented Intern to join our dynamic team. This is an excellent opportunity to gain valuable experience in a fast-paced, innovative environment and contribute to cutting-edge projects.

Responsibilities

The Intern will work closely with experienced engineers and contribute to various projects, including:

  • Assisting in the development and testing of software applications.
  • Conducting research and analysis on emerging technologies.
  • Providing technical support to the engineering team.
  • Documenting technical specifications and procedures.

Required Skills and Qualifications

  • Currently pursuing a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.
  • Proficiency in at least one programming language, such as C/C++ or Java.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Exposure to Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML) concepts.
  • Familiarity with database management systems.

What We Offer

Harman offers a comprehensive and competitive benefits package, including:

  • Flexible Work Environment: The opportunity for full-time remote work globally for eligible roles.
  • Employee Discounts: Exclusive discounts on Harman and Samsung products, including JBL, HARMAN Kardon, and AKG.
  • Professional Development: Access to HARMAN University for continuous learning and skill enhancement.
  • Wellness Benefits: Comprehensive health and wellness programs to support employee well-being.
  • Tuition Reimbursement: Financial assistance for continuing education.
  • On-Site Amenities: Access to fitness centers and cafeterias at select Harman locations.
  • Diversity and Inclusion: A welcoming and inclusive work environment that values diversity and promotes equal opportunities.

job_description:
Intern – Electrical Engineering at GE Vernova

About GE Vernova

GE Vernova is a global leader in developing and delivering innovative energy solutions. Driven by a commitment to sustainability and technological advancement, GE Vernova empowers businesses and communities to thrive in a rapidly changing world.

Job Summary

GE Vernova is seeking a highly motivated and talented Electrical Engineering Intern to join the Electrical Design and Power Electronics Engineering team. This internship offers a unique opportunity to gain hands-on experience in a dynamic and challenging environment, working alongside experienced professionals on cutting-edge projects.

Responsibilities

As an Electrical Engineering Intern, you will contribute to various projects within the Electrical Design and Power Electronics Engineering team, including:

  • Electrical and Circuit Design: Assist in the design and development of electrical circuits and systems, utilizing industry-standard software tools and design principles.
  • Filter and Insulation Coordination: Participate in the analysis and design of filter systems and insulation coordination strategies for electrical equipment, ensuring optimal performance and safety.
  • Equipment Lifecycle Analysis: Contribute to the assessment of equipment lifecycle performance, including reliability, availability, and maintainability (RAM) analysis.
  • Power Loss Management: Assist in identifying and mitigating electrical losses in power systems, optimizing efficiency and reducing energy consumption.
  • Dynamic Studies: Participate in dynamic studies related to control and protection systems, utilizing simulation software to analyze system behavior under various operating conditions.
  • Control and Protection System Strategy: Contribute to the development of strategies for control and protection systems, ensuring reliable and safe operation of electrical equipment.
  • Automation and Control Systems: Gain experience with automation and control systems, including programming and configuration of industrial control devices.
  • Testing and Validation: Assist in the testing, validation, and verification of hardware and control setups, ensuring compliance with design specifications and industry standards.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree in Electrical & Electronics Engineering.
  • Currently enrolled in a Master's program (minimum one year completed) specializing in Electrical Power Systems or Power Electronics from a recognized institution.

Preferred Skills & Attributes

  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Proficiency in electrical design software tools (e.g., AutoCAD, MATLAB, Simulink).
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Ability to work effectively both independently and as part of a team.
  • Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.
  • Proactive and eager to learn new technologies and concepts.
key_responsibility:
Key Responsibilities: Intern – Electrical Engineering (GE Vernova)

This role offers a hands-on learning experience within GE Vernova's Electrical Design and Power Electronics Engineering team.

Electrical Design & Analysis:

  • Circuit Design: Assist in the design and development of electrical circuits for various applications, utilizing industry-standard software tools. This may involve creating schematics, performing simulations, and analyzing circuit performance.
  • Filter & Insulation Coordination: Contribute to the design and analysis of filters and insulation systems, ensuring optimal performance and compliance with safety standards. This includes selecting appropriate components, performing calculations, and generating technical documentation.
  • Equipment Lifecycle Analysis: Participate in the assessment of equipment lifecycle performance, including reliability, availability, and maintainability (RAM). This involves collecting data, analyzing trends, and identifying potential areas for improvement.
  • Electrical Loss Management: Assist in identifying and mitigating electrical losses within systems and equipment. This may involve conducting simulations, analyzing data, and proposing solutions to optimize energy efficiency.

Power Electronics & Control Systems:

  • Power Electronics Component Analysis: Gain experience in analyzing and evaluating power electronics components, including diodes, transistors, and inverters. This may involve reviewing datasheets, performing simulations, and contributing to component selection.
  • Control & Protection System Development: Support the development and implementation of control and protection systems for electrical equipment. This includes assisting with programming, testing, and commissioning of control logic.
  • Dynamic Studies: Participate in dynamic studies related to control and protection systems, utilizing specialized software tools to analyze system behavior under various operating conditions.

Testing & Validation:

  • Subsystem-Level Testing: Prepare and execute validation and testing procedures for electrical subsystems, ensuring compliance with design specifications and performance requirements.
  • Hardware & Control Setup Verification: Assist in the testing and verification of hardware and control setups, documenting test results and identifying potential issues.

Collaboration & Documentation:

  • Technical Issue Resolution: Work with mentors to identify and resolve technical issues encountered during project execution.
  • Documentation Support: Assist in preparing technical documentation related to ongoing projects, including reports, presentations, and design specifications.
  • Project Team Support: Provide technical inputs and support to project teams as required, contributing to the successful completion of project objectives.

AI/ML engineers at Allstate will work with diverse data sources, requiring skills in data cleaning, transformation, and feature engineering to prepare data for model training.

  • Continuous Learning: The field of AI/ML is rapidly evolving. A commitment to continuous learning and staying updated with the latest advancements is crucial for success in this role.

Uber Software Engineer I: Qualifications & Requirements

This section outlines the typical qualifications and requirements for a Software Engineer I position at Uber.

Technical Skills

  • Programming Languages: Proficiency in at least one object-oriented programming language such as Java, Python, C++, or Go is essential. This is the foundation for writing and maintaining Uber's core software applications. A strong understanding of data structures and algorithms is also crucial for efficient and scalable code development.
  • Software Development Methodologies: Familiarity with Agile development methodologies, such as Scrum or Kanban, is highly valued. Uber operates in a fast-paced environment, and Agile principles ensure rapid iteration, collaboration, and continuous improvement.
  • Databases: Experience with relational databases (e.g., MySQL, PostgreSQL) and NoSQL databases (e.g., MongoDB) is beneficial. Software Engineers at Uber interact with vast amounts of data, requiring the ability to design, query, and manage databases effectively.
  • Cloud Computing: Basic understanding of cloud platforms like AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud is increasingly important. Uber leverages cloud infrastructure for scalability and reliability, so familiarity with cloud concepts is advantageous.

Soft Skills

  • Communication: Excellent written and verbal communication skills are essential for collaborating with cross-functional teams, documenting code, and presenting technical ideas clearly.
  • Problem-Solving: Software Engineers at Uber face complex technical challenges. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills are crucial for identifying root causes, devising solutions, and implementing them effectively.
  • Teamwork: Uber is a highly collaborative environment. The ability to work effectively in teams, contribute ideas, and support colleagues is essential for success.
  • Adaptability: The tech industry is constantly evolving. Software Engineers must be adaptable and willing to learn new technologies and approaches.

These qualifications provide a strong foundation for a successful career as a Software Engineer I at Uber.
job_description:
Software Engineer I

Company: Uber

Location: [City, State]

About the Role

Uber is seeking a motivated and talented Software Engineer I to join our growing Technology team. In this role, you will play a key part in the design, development, and deployment of new and innovative software systems. You will collaborate with a team of experienced engineers to deliver high-quality solutions that meet the evolving needs of our users.

Responsibilities

  • Apply your understanding of software development best practices and foundational technical knowledge to identify system enhancements and potential areas for improvement.
  • Troubleshoot and evaluate technical issues, providing actionable recommendations and implementing approved changes.
  • Leverage your understanding of business operations and system workflows, coupled with industry best practices, to address and resolve complex technical problems.
  • Analyze data to provide informed recommendations for process improvements and system functionality enhancements.
  • Participate in the testing, debugging, and scripting phases of the software development lifecycle.
  • Write clean, well-documented code based on provided design specifications.
  • Adapt your existing knowledge and experience to assess situations not explicitly outlined by procedures and evaluate the most appropriate solutions.
  • Gain familiarity with Uber's IT infrastructure, including server-side development, network systems, database management, and cloud technologies.
  • Make informed decisions with awareness of associated risks, ensuring compliance with legal and regulatory standards while upholding ethical business conduct and maintaining transparency in managing and reporting control issues.

Qualifications

  • 0 to 2 years of relevant experience in application development.
  • Hands-on experience with coding and debugging in business applications.
  • Familiarity with common industry standards and practices, such as Agile methodologies and version control systems (e.g., Git).
  • Strong understanding of object-oriented programming principles.
  • Proficiency in one or more programming languages, such as Java, Python, or C++.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills with an emphasis on clarity and precision.

Educational Requirements

  • A bachelor's degree or equivalent professional experience in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.
key_responsibility:
Software Engineer I - Key Responsibilities at Uber

This section outlines the key duties and responsibilities expected of a Software Engineer I at Uber.

Software Development & Problem Solving

  • System Enhancement & Troubleshooting:
    • Analyze existing software systems to identify areas for improvement and propose innovative solutions.
    • Investigate and diagnose technical issues reported by users or internal teams.

  • Code Development & Testing:

Collaboration & Communication

Continuous Learning & Improvement

  • Technical Growth:

about_company:
About Uber

Uber is a global leader in ridesharing and transportation technology, connecting riders with drivers through its innovative platform. Founded in 2009, Uber has revolutionized the way people move, providing convenient, reliable, and affordable transportation options in over 600 cities worldwide.

Mission and Vision:

Uber's mission is to make transportation as reliable as running water, accessible to everyone, everywhere. The company envisions a future where cities are less congested, more efficient, and more sustainable, powered by its technology and commitment to innovation.

Culture and Values:

Uber fosters a dynamic and collaborative work environment that values diversity, inclusion, and a passion for solving complex problems. The company encourages its employees to think big, take risks, and make a real impact on the world.

Market Position and Growth:

As the world's largest ridesharing platform, Uber holds a dominant market share and continues to expand its reach globally. The company is constantly innovating, introducing new services like Uber Eats, Uber Freight, and Uber for Business, to meet the evolving needs of its users.

Uber's commitment to technological advancement, coupled with its global presence and customer-centric approach, positions it as a key player in shaping the future of transportation.
selection_process:
Uber Software Engineer I Hiring Workflow

This multi-stage process aims to identify the best candidates for the Software Engineer I role at Uber, focusing on technical skills, problem-solving abilities, and cultural fit.

1. Application Screening (1-2 weeks)

  • What happens: Candidates submit resumes and cover letters through the Uber careers portal. Recruiters review applications, focusing on relevant experience, skills, and education.
  • Who's involved: Recruiters and hiring managers.
  • Duration: 1-2 weeks.
  • Evaluation criteria: Alignment with job requirements, technical skills, relevant experience, and communication skills.
  • Candidate expectations: Submit a well-written resume and cover letter highlighting relevant skills and experience.

2. Phone Interview (1 week)

  • What happens: Short phone interviews with recruiters to assess communication skills, cultural fit, and basic technical understanding.
  • Who's involved: Recruiters.
  • Duration: 30-45 minutes.
  • Evaluation criteria: Communication skills, enthusiasm, problem-solving aptitude, and alignment with Uber's values.
  • Candidate expectations: Prepare for behavioral questions and basic technical inquiries.

3. Technical Assessment (1 week)

  • What happens: Candidates complete a technical assessment, which may include coding challenges, algorithm problems, or system design questions.
  • Who's involved: Hiring managers and technical recruiters.
  • Duration: 2-3 hours.
  • Evaluation criteria: Coding proficiency, problem-solving skills, understanding of data structures and algorithms, and system design knowledge.
  • Candidate expectations: Practice coding challenges and familiarize themselves with common technical interview questions.

4. On-Site Interview (1-2 weeks)

  • What happens: Candidates participate in multiple interviews with hiring managers, engineers, and potentially other team members. Interviews may include behavioral questions, technical discussions, and system design exercises.
  • Who's involved: Hiring managers, engineers, and team members.
  • Duration: 4-6 hours.
  • Evaluation criteria: Technical expertise, problem-solving abilities, communication skills, teamwork, and cultural fit.
  • Candidate expectations: Prepare for in-depth technical discussions, behavioral questions, and system design challenges.

5. Offer and Onboarding (1-2 weeks)

  • What happens: Selected candidates receive a formal job offer, followed by onboarding processes to integrate them into the Uber team.
  • Who's involved: Recruiters, hiring managers, and HR.
  • Duration: 1-2 weeks.
  • Evaluation criteria: Candidate acceptance of the offer and successful completion of onboarding procedures.
  • Candidate expectations: Review the offer carefully and complete all necessary onboarding paperwork.

This comprehensive selection process ensures Uber hires the best talent for their Software Engineer I roles, balancing technical skills with cultural fit and problem-solving abilities.

qualification:
Java Developer – Fixed Term Contract (6 Months) - Typical Qualifications & Requirements

This section outlines the typical qualifications and requirements for a Java Developer position at NatWest Group, assuming no specific details are provided in the job posting.

Technical Skills

  • Java Programming Language (Expert Level): A strong foundation in Java is essential. This includes proficiency in core Java concepts like object-oriented programming, data structures, algorithms, and multithreading. The developer will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining Java-based applications, requiring a deep understanding of the language's syntax, libraries, and best practices.
  • Spring Framework (Proficient Level): Familiarity with the Spring Framework, particularly Spring Boot, is highly desirable. This framework simplifies Java development by providing tools for dependency injection, data access, web development, and more. Experience with Spring MVC or Spring REST would be beneficial for building web applications.
  • Databases (Intermediate Level): Knowledge of relational databases like MySQL or PostgreSQL is crucial. The developer should be able to write SQL queries, understand database design principles, and interact with databases through Java applications. Experience with NoSQL databases like MongoDB would be a plus.
  • Version Control Systems (Proficient Level): Experience with Git or similar version control systems is essential for collaborative development and code management. The developer should be comfortable with branching, merging, and resolving conflicts.

Soft Skills

  • Problem-Solving: Java developers often encounter complex technical challenges. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills are needed to identify root causes, develop solutions, and implement them effectively.
  • Communication: Clear and concise communication is vital for collaborating with team members, understanding requirements, and explaining technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
  • Teamwork: Java development projects often involve working in teams. The ability to collaborate effectively, share knowledge, and contribute to a positive team environment is essential.

These qualifications provide a strong foundation for a successful Java Developer at NatWest Group.
job_description:
Java Developer – Fixed Term Contract (6 months)

NatWest Group

About NatWest Group

NatWest Group is a leading provider of banking and financial services in the United Kingdom and internationally. With a rich history and a commitment to innovation, NatWest Group serves millions of customers through its various brands, including NatWest, RBS, and Ulster Bank.

Job Overview

NatWest Group is seeking a skilled and motivated Java Developer to join a dynamic team on a fixed-term contract for a period of six months. The successful candidate will play a key role in the development and maintenance of critical applications, contributing to the delivery of innovative solutions that enhance the customer experience.

Responsibilities

  • Design, develop, and implement Java-based applications using industry best practices and coding standards.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including business analysts, testers, and other developers, to ensure successful project delivery.
  • Participate in code reviews, providing constructive feedback and ensuring code quality.
  • Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues, identifying root causes and implementing effective solutions.
  • Stay abreast of emerging technologies and industry trends, proposing and implementing innovative solutions.

Required Skills and Experience

  • Proven experience in developing Java applications using frameworks such as Spring or Hibernate.
  • Strong understanding of object-oriented programming principles and design patterns.
  • Proficiency in SQL and experience with relational databases.
  • Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
  • Strong communication and collaboration skills.

Desirable Skills and Experience

  • Experience with cloud computing platforms such as AWS or Azure.
  • Knowledge of agile development methodologies.
  • Experience with DevOps practices.
key_responsibility:
Java Developer – Fixed Term Contract (6 months) - Key Responsibilities

While a detailed job description is unavailable, we can outline typical responsibilities for a Java Developer based on industry standards and the "Fixed Term Contract" nature of the position.

qualification:
SASKEN - Engineer - Software Test & Release: Typical Qualifications & Requirements

This section outlines the typical qualifications and requirements for the Engineer - Software Test & Release position at SASKEN.

I. Education & Experience

  • Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field: A strong foundation in computer science principles is essential for understanding software development processes and testing methodologies.
  • 3+ years of experience in software testing and release engineering: This demonstrates practical experience in designing, executing, and managing software testing processes, as well as experience in deploying and releasing software applications.

II. Technical Skills

  • Proficiency in software testing methodologies (e.g., black-box, white-box, grey-box): The ability to apply various testing techniques to ensure comprehensive software quality is crucial.
  • Experience with test automation frameworks (e.g., Selenium, Appium): Automating test cases significantly improves efficiency and reduces manual effort in the testing process.
  • Knowledge of version control systems (e.g., Git): Version control is essential for managing code changes, collaborating with developers, and tracking software releases.
  • Familiarity with continuous integration/continuous delivery (CI/CD) pipelines: Understanding CI/CD principles allows for streamlined and automated software releases.
  • Scripting skills (e.g., Python, Bash): Scripting is valuable for automating tasks, analyzing test results, and customizing testing environments.

III. Soft Skills

  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills: Identifying and resolving software defects requires critical thinking and analytical abilities.
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills: Effective communication with developers, product managers, and other stakeholders is essential for successful software testing and release.
  • Attention to detail and a commitment to quality: Thoroughness and a focus on delivering high-quality software are paramount in this role.

These qualifications provide a comprehensive overview of the typical requirements for the Engineer - Software Test & Release position at SASKEN.
job_description:
Engineer - Software Test & Release

Company: SASKEN

Job Summary

This role is an entry-level position within SASKEN's engineering team, focusing on the testing and release of software solutions. The successful candidate will demonstrate a foundational understanding of software development principles and possess a strong aptitude for technical problem-solving. They will work closely with senior engineers and team leads to ensure the quality and timely delivery of software products.

Roles & Responsibilities

  • Design, code, test, debug, document, and provide technical support for assigned software modules within defined project timelines.
  • Adhere to established coding standards, review checklists, and organizational processes to ensure consistent quality and efficiency.
  • Execute test plans, analyze test results, and report defects to the development team.
  • Collaborate with team members to resolve technical issues and contribute to continuous improvement initiatives.
  • Participate in code reviews and knowledge sharing sessions to enhance technical expertise.
  • Stay abreast of industry best practices and emerging technologies through training, self-learning, and technical evaluations.

Education and Experience

  • Bachelor's degree in Engineering (Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or related field), MCA, or equivalent.
  • 0 to 2 years of experience in software development or testing.

Competency Overview

  • Protocol Testing Expertise:
    • Conduct protocol stack testing for modems and user equipment (UE).
    • Execute interoperability testing between modems and various network providers, including interaction with Network Equipment Manufacturers (NEMs) such as Ericsson, Nokia, and Alcatel-Lucent.
    • Understand signaling and user plane call flows, create and run test plans using automated frameworks, and analyze logs for debugging and issue resolution.
  • Technical Proficiency:
    • Strong grasp of 3GPP Radio Access Technologies, including air interface, signaling protocols, and Layer 2/3 for both UE and RAN, as well as the NAS layer from the UE to the core network.
    • Experience with automation using scripting languages such as PERL, Python, and TTCN.
  • Platform Familiarity:
    • Experience with internal and customer-specific platforms, primarily Linux-based systems.
  • Tool Expertise:
    • Hands-on experience with tools like QXDM, QCAT, QPST, Prism, Anritsu, and Keysight.
    • Proficient in using test scripting tools such as RTD (for Anritsu) and equivalents.
    • Familiar with trace and log analysis tools, core dump analysis tools, and flashing utilities.
  • Programming & Scripting Languages:
    • Proficient in Shell scripting, TCL, Python, Perl, and programming languages like C, C++, and TTCN.

Areas of Expertise

  • Specialized knowledge in 2G, 3G, 4G, 5G technologies, interoperability testing, and VSAT-SATCOM.
key_responsibility:
Engineer - Software Test & Release: Key Responsibilities

I. Protocol Testing & Analysis

  • Conduct Protocol Stack Testing: Execute comprehensive tests on modem/UE (User Equipment) to validate adherence to 2G, 3G, LTE, and 5G protocols. This involves analyzing protocol interactions, identifying potential issues, and ensuring seamless communication between the modem and the network.
  • Interoperability Testing: Perform interoperability testing between modems and various network providers, including interaction with Network Equipment Manufacturers (NEMs) like Ericsson, Nokia, and Alcatel-Lucent. This ensures compatibility and seamless data exchange across different network infrastructures.
  • Call Flow Analysis & Debugging: Understand and analyze signaling and user plane call flows to identify bottlenecks or inconsistencies. Utilize automated test frameworks to create and execute test plans, collect logs, and perform in-depth debugging during regression cycles.

II. Test Automation & Scripting

  • Develop & Execute Test Scripts: Utilize scripting languages such as PERL, Python, and TTCN to automate test cases, streamline testing processes, and enhance efficiency.
  • Framework Development & Maintenance: Contribute to the development and maintenance of automated test frameworks, ensuring they are robust, scalable, and aligned with evolving testing needs.

III. Documentation & Reporting

  • Test Plan & Report Generation: Create detailed test plans outlining test objectives, methodologies, and expected outcomes. Generate comprehensive test reports documenting test results, identified issues, and proposed solutions.
  • Technical Documentation: Contribute to the creation and maintenance of technical documentation related to testing procedures, protocols, and tools.

IV. Continuous Learning & Improvement

  • Technical Skill Enhancement: Actively pursue opportunities for professional development through training programs, self-learning initiatives, and participation in technical evaluations.
  • Process Optimization: Identify opportunities to improve testing processes, workflows, and tool utilization, contributing to enhanced efficiency and effectiveness.

V. Collaboration & Communication

  • Teamwork: Collaborate effectively with team members, engineers, and project managers to ensure seamless execution of testing activities and timely delivery of results.
  • Communication: Communicate test results, findings, and potential issues clearly and concisely to relevant stakeholders, both verbally and in writing.

  • Evaluation criteria: Performance on technical assessments, problem-solving aptitude, and attention to detail.
